description:
Please only apply if you have past history of working in short term rental in the United Kingdom 



About Us:

We are a dynamic and growing short-term rental company dedicated to providing exceptional experiences for our guests. We manage a portfolio of properties and strive to offer top-notch service to our clients. We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Virtual Assistant to join our team and help us manage various administrative and operational tasks.



Job Description:

As a Virtual Assistant, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of our short-term rental business. You will be responsible for a variety of tasks, including but not limited to:



Responsibilities:



Responding to guest inquiries and managing bookings through various platforms (e.g., Airbnb, ---------- , etc.)

Coordinating with cleaning and maintenance teams to ensure properties are guest-ready

Updating and managing property listings on rental platforms

Assisting with marketing efforts, including social media management and
 campaigns

Processing payments and managing financial record

We are looking for someone that also has a high grade in accounting

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Strong organizational and multitasking abilities

Experience with short-term rental platforms (e.g., Airbnb, ---------- ) is a plus

title: YouTube Thumbnail Designer
description:
About Viral Vault Studios:

Viral Vault Studios is a digital content creation company dedicated to producing educational and entertaining videos on YouTube. Our mission is to make online learning fun and engaging by creating content that captivates and informs global audiences. We focus on high-quality faceless YouTube videos across niches like anime recaps, celebrity health, and more.



We are seeking a creative YouTube Thumbnail Designer with a strong eye for design, branding, and audience engagement. The ideal candidate is skilled in graphic design, YouTube content optimization, click-through-rate (CTR) strategies, and Adobe Photoshop/Canva tools. Your work will directly impact our channel growth by creating high-converting thumbnails that drive clicks and views.



Responsibilities:

- Design engaging and high-quality YouTube thumbnails optimized for clicks and audience retention

- Collaborate with youtube assistants, video editors, and scriptwriters to align thumbnails with video titles, SEO, and branding.

- Research and analyze YouTube trends and competitor thumbnails for inspiration

- Ensure fast turnaround times while maintaining creative excellence.



Qualifications:

- Proven experience as a YouTube Thumbnail Designer or Graphic Designer

- Proficiency in Photoshop, Canva, or similar tools

- Understanding of YouTube SEO, CTR strategies, and audience psychology

- Ability to manage design workflows and coordinate with a creative team

- Familiarity with productivity and collaboration tools such as Asana, Slack, and Clockify

- Strong communication, time management, and creativity



Note: This application has a test task to undergo. If interested, please submit your portfolio and resume with a subject
 "Applying for YouTube Thumbnail Designer"

title: Social Media Manager
description:
About Us:

Viral Vault Studios is a fast-growing company with a strong focus on building engaging digital communities through our social media business. In this role, you’ll primarily lead social media and branding initiatives, with the exciting possibility to also contribute to my other second business, Michaud CPA, an accounting firm. A unique opportunity to gain exposure across two industries, expand your skills, and make a meaningful impact across multiple business units. This is a full-time role that will start at 20–25 hours per week and gradually ramp up to 30-40 hours per week as production and campaigns increase, providing flexibility while scaling into the role.



What You’ll Do:

- Develop and execute end-to-end social media campaigns that drive engagement, growth, and brand awareness

- Manage a high-performing social media and content production team, including video editors, scriptwriters, and voice actors, ensuring smooth workflow and timely delivery

- Lead branding initiatives across multiple channels, aligning with marketing and business objectives

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate social media strategies into broader marketing plans.

- Oversee content calendars, scheduling, and publishing across platforms including Instagram,
, LinkedIn, TikTok, and YouTube

- Monitor, analyze, and report on social media performance metrics to inform strategy

- Stay ahead of trends, platform updates, and best practices in social media, branding, and digital marketing



Qualifications:

- 4+ years of experience in social media management, digital marketing, or related fields

- Proven experience managing a creative team for digital/video content production (video editors, scriptwriters, voice actors).

- Strong project management skills; experience leading multiple campaigns simultaneously

- Expertise in branding, campaign management, and audience engagement strategies

- Proficient with tools like Slack, Clockify, and Asana for team communication, tracking, and project management

- Knowledgeable of SEO, content marketing, and social media analytics tools

- YouTube experience is a plus, including video content strategy, optimization, and community engagement

- Exceptional communication, storytelling, and organizational skills



If you're interested in applying, please attach an accessible link of your updated resume / portfolio and put on the subject "Your Name - Applying for SMM".

title: Sales Assistant
description:

Viral Vault Studios is a fast-growing company with a strong focus on building engaging digital communities through our social media business. The Sales Assistant will primarily support client acquisition and sales initiatives across both our social media company and my second business, an accounting firm, Michaud CPA. A unique opportunity to gain exposure across two industries, expand your skills, and make a meaningful impact across multiple business units. - Proven experience in sales or client acquisition, with a track record of generating leads and closing opportunities

ing, calls, and other outreach channels

- Support the sales process by maintaining records, tracking client interactions, and reporting performance metrics

- Collaborate with marketing and social media teams to align outreach strategies with campaigns

- Contribute ideas and insights to improve sales effectiveness and client engagement strategies.



Requirements:

- 4+ years of experience in sales, client acquisition, or business development

- Strong English communication skills, both verbal and written; neutral accent preferred

- Proven ability to manage follow-ups and maintain long-term client relationships

- Highly organized, self-motivated, and detail-oriented

title: Performance Marketing Lead (Paid Media + Growth Analytics)
description:
About the Role

We are looking for a data-driven Performance Marketing Lead who can scale our D2C business by improving paid media efficiency, strengthening attribution, and driving high-intent traffic. You will own strategy, execution, and analytics across Meta, Google, YouTube, and emerging channels.



Responsibilities

? Plan, launch, and optimize paid campaigns across Meta, Google, YouTube, and Pinterest.

? Own daily CAC, ROAS, MER, revenue, and audience performance reporting.

? Analyze user journeys, identify funnel drop-offs, and propose fixes.

? Lead structured experimentation: creative tests, landing page tests, and offer tests.

? Build keyword-driven creative briefs for new ad sets.

? Collaborate with the CRO Manager to improve landing page conversion.

? Monitor attribution using GA4 + Triple Whale/Northbeam.

? Scale winning campaigns while keeping CAC within target.

? Identify new opportunities in remarketing, retention, and LTV improvement.



Requirements

? 3–5 years of experience in D2C performance marketing (beauty/wellness preferred).

? Deep expertise with Meta + Google Ads.

? Proficiency in GA4, pixel setup, conversion APIs, and attribution frameworks.

? Proven track record in improving CAC and scaling spend efficiently.

? Strong analytical skills; ability to translate data into decisions.

? Comfortable owning numbers and working closely with founders.

title: Accountant with Australian experience / knowledge
description:
About the Role



We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Accountant to work for our team in Australia. The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing accurate financial reports, ensuring compliance with Australian taxation and statutory requirements, managing payroll, and overseeing debt collection processes.



This role requires strong technical knowledge of Australian accounting standards and tax regulations, along with excellent organisational and analytical skills.



Key Responsibilities



• Prepare accurate monthly, quarterly and annual financial reports in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards

• Prepare management reports, including profit & loss statements, balance sheets and cash flow statements

• Prepare and lodge Business Activity Statements (BAS) and Instalment Activity Statements (IAS)

• Manage and remit statutory obligations including:



o GST

o PAYG Withholding

o PAYG Instalments

o Superannuation Guarantee contributions

o Payroll Tax 

o Fringe Benefits Tax (FBT)

• Ensure compliance with ATO and other regulatory requirements

• Manage Single Touch Payroll (STP) reporting

• Process and manage end-to-end payroll, ensuring accuracy and compliance

• Oversee accounts receivable and lead debt collection activities, including following up overdue accounts

• Perform bank and general ledger reconciliations

• Assist with budgeting, forecasting and financial analysis

• Support external auditors and liaise with tax advisors when required



Skills & Experience



• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting

• CPA or CA qualification (or working towards) preferred but not mandatory

• Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a similar accounting role in Australia

• Strong knowledge of Australian taxation laws and compliance requirements

• Experience preparing and lodging BAS

• Proficiency in accounting software , preferably MYOB, although we plan to move to XERO in the future

• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills

• High level of accuracy and attention to detail

• Strong communication and problem-solving skills

• Ability to meet deadlines and manage competing priorities



What We Offer



• Competitive remuneration package including 13th month

• Supportive and collaborative work environment

• Opportunities for professional development and growth



You will be reporting to the CEO and will have external accounting advice and support from our external Tax accountant.

title: Senior Webflow Designer
description:
About the Project:



I am a UK-based HR and employment law consultant repositioning my boutique consultancy toward strategic advisory and board-level services. 



-This is not a startup brand. 

-This is not an e-commerce site. 

-This is a premium professional services website. 



The goal is a clean, intelligent, grounded, bilingual Webflow website using a purchased premium template (Nikka). 

You will not be building from scratch — you will be refining and elevating. 



Scope of Work: 

-Customise purchased Webflow template 

-Implement brand colour system (dark-led, structured) 

-Apply typography (Exo + Montserrat) 

-Improve layout spacing and hierarchy 

-Advise on section structure where needed 

-Light copy refinement (clarity, grammar, tone polish) 

-Build structured bilingual setup (English + Greek path – you don’t need to know Greek, don’t worry!) 

-Implement subtle motion/animations professionally 

-Add client logo carousel 

-Ensure full mobile optimisation 

-Apply basic technical SEO (meta titles, alt text, H1 structure) 

-Connect the domain and prepare for launch. 



This Is NOT For You If: 

-You mainly build Shopify or WordPress sites 

-Your portfolio is colourful, startup-heavy, or sales-funnel focused 

-You rely heavily on AI-generated content 

-You cannot show consultancy or professional services examples 

-You struggle with English nuance. 



This IS For You If: 

-You are strong in Webflow (5+ years minimum) 

-You understand premium professional service positioning 

-You have built sites for consultants, law firms, strategy firms, or advisory businesses 

-You care deeply about spacing, typography, and hierarchy 

-You can suggest improvements instead of just following instructions 

-You communicate clearly and professionally. 



Deliverables:

-Fully customised Webflow site 

-Clean and elegant execution 

-Desktop + tablet + mobile optimisation 

-Bilingual structure implemented properly (no Google Translate plugins) 

-Site ready for domain connection and launch. 



To Apply:

Please include: 

1. 3 Webflow sites you have built that are clean, minimal, and professional 

2. A short paragraph explaining how you would elevate a premium consultancy template 

3. Please include your hourly rate and fixed project estimate in your application. 



Applications without portfolio links will not be considered.  



Budget:

I am willing to pay above-average rates for strong Webflow expertise and clean execution. 

This is not a “cheap build” project. Quality and attention to detail matter. 



In your application, include the word “Structure” at the top so I know you read the full description.

title: FUNNELISH FUNNEL BUILDER WANTED FOR 7-FIGURE ECOMMERCE BRAND
description:
Hey there,



My team and I are looking for a talented Funnel Builder to join our amazing 7-figure eCommerce dropshipping business!



We’re searching for someone who is passionate about building high-converting sales funnels, optimizing customer journeys, and creating beautiful, functional landing pages that convert visitors into loyal customers.



You’ll be responsible for one of the most important aspects of our business — designing and improving sales funnels that directly impact revenue.



It’s essential that you already have experience with:

Basic understanding of conversion psychology and marketing principles

Integrations using Funnelish and Shopify



You’ll work closely with our CEO and Process Manager to create funnel concepts, optimize existing flows, and make sure everything runs smoothly, from landing page to checkout.



ROLE:

You’ll be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing conversion-focused funnels for our products and campaigns.



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create sales funnels and advertorials

Integrate automations, payment gateways, and
 sequences

Continuously optimize conversion rates using A/B testing

Ensure brand consistency across all funnel designs

Work closely with the Process Manager to maintain funnel benchmarks

Keep all funnels live, functional, and mobile-optimized



RESULTS:

Build or optimize 6-8 funnels per week

Achieve or improve conversion rate targets (20%+ increase where possible)

Deliver fully functional, automated funnels with no technical errors

Continuously improve your skills and speed week by week



REQUIREMENTS:

Fluent in English (spoken & written)

Experience with Funnelish, Shopify

Familiar with automation tools

Understanding of conversion optimization and user experience

Able to use Canva, Photoshop, ChatGPT for light graphic editing

Fast and stable internet connection

Detail-oriented, proactive, and reliable



WHAT WE OFFER:

A long-term position in a growing 7-figure brand

A collaborative and respectful remote team

Training opportunities to help you grow with the company

Performance-based bonuses and raises

A company culture focused on personal growth, communication, and freedom



HOW TO APPLY:

Briefly tell about yourself - Experience - How long you've been doing this

Attach some website URL's showing your Funnelish work

Attach a CV

title: Content Research & Production Coordinator for Fast-Growing YouTube Channel
description:
We run a travel and digital lifestyle YouTube channel focused on helping people travel smarter and safer. Our audience includes digital nomads, frequent travelers, and people planning international moves.

We create detailed, well-researched videos about topics like travel security, digital tools for travelers, avoiding scams, and navigating complex travel situations.

We're growing fast and we need the right person to help us scale production without sacrificing quality.



This is not a typical "YouTube VA" job where you post thumbnails and schedule uploads.

This is a content operations role for someone who loves the behind-the-scenes work that makes great content possible.



You'll be the person who:

> Researches topics deeply so the host can speak confidently

> Organizes chaos into clear, usable structures

> Prepares everything the editor needs to do their best work

> Makes sure nothing falls through the cracks between idea and published video



What You'll Actually Do Each Week



Research & Verification (40% of your time)

When we d
 to create a video, you become the information detective.

You'll:

> Find credible sources (official sites, news, expert interviews)

> Gather real examples and case studies

> Verify facts and statistics

> Flag weak or unverifiable claims

> Organize everything into a clear research document



Example task: We're making a video about "Passport Scams Targeting Americans in Europe."

You'll find:

> Official US State Department warnings

> News stories of actual i

> Statistics on passport theft

> Expert quotes from security professionals

> Screenshots and visual examples

You'll organize it all so we can confidently say: "This is real, here's the proof."



Script Development Support (25% of your time)

You'll use AI tools (we'll train you) to help create structured first drafts.

You'll:

> Input research into AI writing tool (Claude)

> Generate organized script outlines

> Prepare first draft for host review

> Ensure all claims are backed by your research

> Note where personal stories should go



Production Coordination (20% of your time)

After filming, you prepare the "production package" for our video editor.

You'll:

> Gather B-roll reference images and videos

> Collect screenshots of websites or apps mentioned

> Prepare sponsor materials and affiliate links

> Create a clear brief for the editor

> Organize all files with clear naming



The editor's feedback should be: "This was so organized, I had everything I needed."



Publishing & Distribution (15% of your time)

You'll handle the technical publishing process.

You'll:

> Upload videos to YouTube

> Write descriptions using our template

> Add timestamps and tags

> Insert affiliate links correctly

> Schedule the release

> Create and send weekly newsletter featuring the video



You're Perfect for This If You:



You're a researcher at heart

> You don't just Google — you dig until you find the real answer

> You can spot the difference between a credible source and clickbait

> You verify claims instead of accepting them

> You get annoyed when sources contradict each other without explanation



You're exceptionally detail-oriented

> You notice typos that others miss

> You double-check everything before submitting

> You create systems to avoid forgetting steps

> You feel uncomfortable when something is "close enough"



You write excellent English

> Your writing is clear, natural, and grammatically correct

> You can adapt tone and style to match a brand voice

> You communicate complex information simply

> People don't have to re-read your messages to understand them



You're a systems thinker

> You like checklists and processes

> You can follow multi-step workflows consistently

> You document as you go

> You look for ways to make processes better



You're independently capable

> You can figure things out without constant supervision

> You know when to ask questions vs. solve problems yourself

 > You take ownership of your work

 > You don't wait for someone to tell you what to do next



You're professionally reliable

> You respond to messages within 2 hours during work time

> You meet deadlines without last-minute drama

 > You communicate proactively when issues arise

> You do what you say you'll do



Background & Experience That Helps

We're looking for people with:

> Strong research background

> Academic research experience

> Journalism or fact-checking work

> Professional writing or content creation

> Executive assistance with research components



Digital literacy

> Comfortable with multiple software tools

> Quick learner with new platforms

> Basic understanding of YouTube and analytics

> Experience with AI writing tools (bonus, not required)



Content coordination experience

> YouTube production or content operations

> Project coordination in creative environments

> Editorial assistance or content management

> Social media content production



Ideal but not required:

> Previous YouTube channel experience (any size)

> Travel industry or travel content background



Schedule & Time Zone Requirements

Required overlap hours:

> You must be available during late afternoon/evening Central Europe Time (CET)

> This is morning time in US Eastern Time (EST)

> For Philippines-based candidates: This means approximately 9-11 PM Manila time



Schedule reality:

> This is not a strict 9-5 job

> Production happens on a weekly cycle

> Some weeks are busier than others

> You'll work when the work needs to happen, but we also respect boundaries and plan ahead

> During training, we'll be flexible to find overlap that works



Expected hours:

> Starting: 10 hours/week (part-time)

> After 90 days: 15-20 hours/week

> At full production: 20-25 hours/week (potential for full-time)



Tools You'll Use (Full Training Provided)

You don't need to know these now, but you need to be someone who learns quickly.

> ClickUp (project management and task tracking)

> Claude AI (script development and content generation)

> Google Drive (file organization and asset management)

> 
 (video review and collaboration with editor)

> YouTube Studio (uploading, optimization, publishing)

> MailerLite (newsletter creation)

We provide complete training on every tool. What matters is that you're a fast learner who actually uses tools correctly.



Compensation

Competitive hourly rate based on your experience and capability.

This role requires more skill than standard VA work, and compensation reflects that.

> Rate range: $6-12/hour depending on experience level

Entry level but capable: $6-7/hour

Strong researcher with some experience: $7-9/hour

Excellent operator with proven background: $9-12/hour



Payment schedule: Bi-Weekly via Wise

Performance reviews: 90 days, then every 6 months with opportunity for increases



Growth Opportunity



This isn't a dead-end role.

As the channel grows, this position can evolve into:

> Senior Production Coordinator (training and managing a junior researcher)

> Production Manager (overseeing the full production pipeline)

> Content Strategy role (helping shape what we create, not just how)

We're building a team for the long term. If you're exceptional at this work, there's real room to grow with us.



How to Apply



Please submit your resume together with:



1. Brief introduction (
words)

Tell us about yourself:

> Your background and relevant experience

> Why this role interests you specifically

> What makes you good at research and organization



2. Availability confirmation

Confirm:

> Your time zone

> Your available hours per week

> Whether you can work late afternoon/evening your time



3. Include the word "Atlas" in your
 subject line



This role is for someone who genuinely enjoys the process of creating great content, not just the outcome.

You're not going to be famous. You're not going to be the face of the channel.

But you will be the reason the channel runs smoothly and grows consistently.



You'll be the person who makes it possible for the host to focus on being great on camera and for the editor to do their best creative work.



If that sounds fulfilling to you, we want to hear from you.

Ready to apply? Send your application with all required elements to: 
 



We're reviewing applications on a rolling basis and will contact qualified candidates within 5 business days.

title: Website Project Manager
description:
Web Project Manager: Full Time



An exciting opportunity exists for a Project Manager in the online marketing and website design industry.



This position is suited to someone who loves organising and interacting with clients.



From client onboarding, setting them up in our project management system, to sending the briefing questionnaires, collating their responses and information for the website project.



To oversight on the design, managing the actual build, then to client preview, to the final site go live process.



Project Management requires high attention to detail. That starts NOW, if you can't follow the job ad process then you will automatically exclude your application from consideration.



Must have a reliable internet connection and good PC.

Must know WordPress (not just how to spell it).

Must understand website design.



NOTE: Please submit a voice recording explaining why you are the best person for the job.



===============================================================================



Remuneration by agreement

• Permanent Basis (long term)

• 40 hours per week

• Rapidly growing company (Lots of work on its books)



The company is situated in Perth, Western Australia (So same time zone as the Philippines).



MUSTS:

• Good spoken English

• Good written English

===============================================================================

Customer Service & Admin Support

• Customer Support

•
 Support

• Phone Support



Project Management

• Design Project Management

• Web Development Project Management

===============================================================================



We build websites, from business start-ups to sophisticated high level websites.



We also do SEO, social media, copywriting, and most things digital marketing or website related.



Website project management is a high attention to detail role. You cannot fake attention to detail, you either have it, or you don’t.



Don’t waste your time or ours if that’s not you.



From when a new client comes on board, to the briefing, data collation and tracking, guidance with the client for the layout and website functionality, and then through to design concepts, and then onto tasking and liaising with the design and build team for the actual build and implementation.



This is a marketing ideas role, and a communication role requiring good interpersonal skills.



EG: In a recent simple project the client had 3 primary services, hats, shirts and badges. In the design layout and function briefing it was d
 we were to create 3 primary ‘doorway’ buttons on one row on the homepage linking to those product pages.



The client then requested a 4th button to showcase suppliers.



We could do that, add a 4th button on that one row, no problems.



But, was that a good marketing or design decision? Was it going to be in the client’s best interest?



Should that page have the same priority as the 3 main product pages?



What would your response have been to that client’s request?



We have broken the website build process into 10 distinct stages, from project setup and client onboarding right through to design and build and onto quality assurance, a clear ‘go live’ process and handover steps to project completion rap up.



There are 560 specific steps in this process, and it’s the project managers role to make sure they’re all adhered to in their fullness but a timely manner to deliver a high-end product.



Software we use:

• Teamwork: For client communication, project management, time tracking.

• Zoom

• Slack for team comms

• WHMCS for client support

• Process St for ALL processes and systems

• Trello for tasking

• RoboForm for password management

• OneDrive for all file assets



What does your day look like?

• Morning check in – Daily Focus session

• Check
s for project notifications, respond

• Follow up with clients

• Follow up with team, and check tasks previously assigned

• Ensure that new project tasks are assigned to team

• Liaise with clients

• Handle brief questionnaires with clients

• Handle layout and function briefings with clients

• Check off that process has been adhered to

• Manage team and resources



Here’s the question:



Can you see your existing skills sets being suited to these daily tasks?



We have a local tech, who handles the phones, helps in support and also does our SEO.



We have another local tech, who handles the hosting, website version updates, managed support and all things WordPress for clients.



We have several designers and web build dev’s who handles the design concepts, and the actual build as such.



We also have a remote marketing person, who is our CRM specialist on the team.



There is also a content marketing and social media specialist.



So, is that you?



Remember, don’t theorise about this!



Website project management is a high attention to detail role. You cannot fake attention to detail, you either have it, or you don’t.



Don’t waste your time or ours if that’s not you.

title: GMC Compliant Store Builder
description:
We are looking for Google Merchant Center Compliant Store Builder, Who is Experienced with oppening Mulitple Stores Per Week.



About Us

We are a fast-growing e-commerce company operating multiple Shopify stores across Europe and North America. With a fully remote team of 25+ professionals, we're scaling aggressively toward 2026—and we need someone who can build the foundation of every store we launch.



The Role

This is a specialized position focused on one thing: building new Shopify stores from scratch that are 100% ready for Google Merchant Center approval. You'll work from our established templates, SOPs, and checklists to create 5–7 stores per week. This isn't a general Shopify, CRO, or marketing role—it's precision work for someone who thrives on structure, consistency, and getting every detail right.



What You'll Do

Build new Shopify stores from scratch using our predefined templates

Configure store structure, pages, navigation, policies, and settings according to detailed checklists

Ensure full compliance with Google Merchant Center guidelines

Prepare stores for GMC submission—zero missing requirements, zero errors

Follow SOPs precisely and document completion for each store

Conduct thorough quality checks before handoff



Who You Are

Detail-obsessed: You catch mistakes others miss and take pride in flawless execution

Process-driven: You follow templates and checklists without deviation

Fast and accurate: You work efficiently, but never sacrifice quality for speed

Self-motivated: You thrive in remote environments and manage your own workflow



Requirements

Proven experience setting up Shopify stores from scratch

Strong working knowledge of Shopify settings, pages, policies, and store structure

Familiarity with Google Merchant Center requirements and compliance

Track record of delivering error-free work at scale



Performance Expectations

Deliver 5–7 fully built Shopify stores per week

Pass internal compliance checks on every store

Achieve GMC submission readiness with no missing elements



What We Offer

100% remote position

Long-term collaboration with a fast-scaling company

Competitive compensation based on experience and output



How to Apply

Send us:

Your resume

A brief note explaining why precision-focused, structured work suits you

Examples of Shopify stores you've built from scratch, Compliant with the Google Merchant Center Policies

Your salary expectations

If you love building things right the first time—every time—we'd love to hear from you.

title: Senior Risk & Compliance Consultant (Fintech & Crypto)
description:
We need an expert who bridges the gap between Web2 Traditional Finance (Fiat Rails) and Web3 On-chain Compliance.

Your core mission is not just to be a "blocker," but to "design safe mechanisms that enable business velocity." You will ensure we pass the rigorous onboarding requirements of our banking partners (e.g., Cybrid's AML program review) while managing the operational risks of a high-volume payment platform.



Key Responsibilities

Compliance Program Build-out

Draft BSA/AML Policies from Scratch: Create internal compliance policy documents (CIP, AML, OFAC) that meet US banking standards. This is a prerequisite for going live with partners like Cybrid.

Define KYC/KYB Standards: Design tiered identity verification workflows for our dual-track business (B2B Agency + B2C Palau ID). Define limits and requirements for Tier 1 vs. Tier 2 users.

Regulatory Strategy: Assess licensing requirements (MTL/MSB/MiCA) for US, Canada, and EU markets, providing a strategic roadmap for the next 12-24 months.

Operational Risk & Fraud Prevention

ACH Risk Management: specifically for ACH Pull scenarios. Design logic to mitigate NSF (Insufficient Funds) and Unauthorized Returns (e.g., balance checks via Plaid, settlement holding periods).

On-Chain Risk Integration: Configure on-chain analysis tools (e.g., GoPlus, Chainalysis, Elliptic) to define blocking rules for high-risk wallet addresses.

Transaction Monitoring: Set up velocity limits and alert rules for suspicious activities; handle Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) if necessary.

Partner Enablement

Due Diligence (DD): Represent the company in handling compliance inquiries from upstream banking partners and infrastructure providers (Cybrid, Hex Trust), assisting in completing complex DD questionnaires.

Vendor Assessment: Evaluate the compliance robustness of new payment rails (e.g., European SEPA, Asian local payouts).



Requirements

Experience: 5+ years of risk/compliance experience in Fintech or Crypto Exchanges. Must have hands-on experience with US Banking Rails (ACH/Wire).

Expertise:

Deep knowledge of FinCEN, OFAC sanctions, and AML workflows.

Strong understanding of the "FBO Account" model and the legal boundaries of a "Money Transmitter."

Understanding of stablecoin (USDC) minting and burning flows.

Tool Stack: Familiarity with industry-standard tools like Persona (Identity), Plaid (Bank Auth), and Chainalysis/TRM Labs (Crypto AML).

Mindset: Ability to balance "Compliance Requirements" with "User Experience." We don't need a bureaucrat; we need a builder who offers solutions.



Bonus Points

Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (CAMS) certification.

Experience helping startups successfully onboard with Zero Hash, Cybrid, Circle, or Stripe.

Knowledge of RNS.ID (Palau Digital Residency) or similar sovereign identity projects.

Familiarity with India TDS tax regulations or Philippines cross-border remittance laws.

title: Dropshipping Virtual Assistant - Shopify & E-commerce Experience Required
description:
Experienced Freelancer Wanted - Honest Communication Valued Above All



We're looking for someone who already knows e-commerce basics and has worked as a freelancer before. You should be comfortable with Shopify and understand how online stores work.



What matters most: Your honesty, reliability, and ability to follow (and improve) our processes.



About Us

We're a growing e-commerce company building a culture of honesty, ownership, and continuous improvement. We believe in clear processes, open communication, and working with people who genuinely care about doing great work.



The Role - What You'll Actually Do

You'll help us run our dropshipping business by handling:



- Product listing on Shopify - Adding products, descriptions, images, variants, pricing

- Video research - Finding and organizing product videos for marketing

- Pinterest pin creation - Creating pins from the videos you found

- Ad campaign setup - Setting up Pinterest advertising campaigns



We provide:



- Detailed SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) for our specific workflows

- Our tools, templates, and processes

- Support when needed



You bring:



- E-commerce fundamentals (you already know how Shopify works)

- Freelance experience (you know how to work independently)

- Fast execution (you can follow SOPs without constant guidance)



What We're Looking For

Must-Have Qualities

Honest & Direct Communication #1 PRIORITY



- You speak up immediately when tools aren't working or SOPs are unclear

- You're not afraid to say "This process has a problem" or "This tool is broken"

- You give honest feedback even when it's negative

- You tell us the truth, not what you think we want to hear

- Example: If step 5 in our SOP is outdated, you flag it immediately instead of struggling alone



Follows Processes (But Thinks Critically)



- You follow our SOPs exactly as written - no going rogue

- You don't change processes on your own because you "think you know better"

- When you spot issues or improvements, you communicate them

- You understand the importance of consistency and systems



Independent & Self-Sufficient



- You've worked as a freelancer before - you know how to manage your own time

- You solve problems using the SOP first before asking questions

- You have good judgment about when to troubleshoot vs. escalate

- You don't need micromanagement or hand-holding



Fast & Productive Worker



- You work efficiently and maintain focus during your entire shift

- You're committed to full-time work (40+ hours/week minimum)

- You stay productive throughout the day (not just 1-2 hours then disappearing)

- You maintain consistent output quality and speed



Growth-Minded Professional



- You're curious about improving your skills in e-commerce and marketing

- You actively look for ways to do your work better

- You see this as a long-term career opportunity, not just a gig

- You want to develop and take on more responsibility over time



Reliable & Action-Oriented



- When you commit to something, you start immediately (not 2 days later)

- You're available during European working hours (8 AM - 5 PM CET)

- You consistently follow through on what you say you'll do

- You show up and deliver, every single day



Requirements

Must Have - Non-Negotiable



- Proven Shopify experience - You've added products, managed variants, worked in Shopify admin

- E-commerce background - You understand dropshipping, product pages, online stores

- Previous freelance/VA experience - You've worked remotely for clients before

- Excellent English (written and spoken - we have weekly video calls)

- Graphic design basics - Comfortable with Canva or similar tools

- Available 8 AM - 5 PM Central European Time (CET) - This is mandatory

- Stable internet and professional, distraction-free workspace

- Full-time availability - 40+ hours/week, long-term commitment



Deal-Breakers



- Young children or babies needing care during work hours

- Other jobs or commitments during 8 AM - 5 PM CET

- Unreliable internet or frequent power outages

- Only available for part-time or sporadic hours



What We Offer



- Competitive pay: $3 - $5/hour (based on experience)

- Clear SOPs: Know exactly what's expected - no guesswork

- Growth opportunities: Master the role ? more responsibility ? higher pay

- Stable full-time work: 40+ hours/week, long-term position

- Honest culture: Your feedback drives our improvements

- Direct communication: Work directly with founders, no corporate layers

- Skill development: Learn advanced e-commerce strategies and scaling



Our Culture - No Corporate BS

What We Value:



- Brutal honesty - We'd rather hear hard truths than polite lies

- Process adherence with critical thinking - Follow SOPs, but flag issues

- Ownership - You're accountable for your results

- Continuous improvement - Always getting better

- Direct communication - No sugar-coating, no politics



What We Don't Tolerate:



- Saying everything is "fine" when it's clearly not

- Ignoring SOPs and doing things your own way without discussion

- Being too afraid to speak up about problems or broken tools

- Slow, inconsistent work or disappearing during work hours

- Promising to do something then starting days later

- Poor communication that requires constant clarification



How to Apply

1. Video Introduction (3-4 minutes) MANDATORY

Record yourself answering:



- What's your Shopify and e-commerce experience? (Be specific!)

- What freelance/VA work have you done? How long?

- Describe a time you had to tell a client their process or tool wasn't working well

- You're on step 6 of our SOP and it's clearly wrong or outdated - walk us through what you do

- Why are you available to work 8 AM - 5 PM CET? (Address timezone directly)



2. Your Resume/CV with specific e-commerce projects listed

3. Answer These Questions in Your Application:

Experience Questions:



- How long have you worked with Shopify? What specific tasks have you done?

- What e-commerce platforms/tools do you have experience with?

- Have you set up ad campaigns before? Which platforms?

- What design tools do you use? (Canva, Photoshop, etc.)



Scenario Questions:



- You notice our SOP has an inefficient step. What do you do?

- A tool we use crashes mid-task. Walk us through your response.



Technical Setup:



- Describe your workspace (dedicated room? noise level? setup)

- Internet speed test results from 
: Download ____ / Upload ____

- What hours are 8 AM - 5 PM CET in YOUR local time?



Commitment:



- Type exactly: "I confirm I am available 8 AM - 5 PM CET (___AM - ___PM my time), Monday-Friday, 40+ hours/week"

- Do you have any responsibilities (children, other jobs) during these hours?



Portfolio (if applicable):



- Links to Shopify stores you've worked on (if allowed to share)

- Examples of product listings you've created

- Pinterest pins or graphics you've designed



Applications without video will be automatically rejected.



Don't Apply If You...



- Haven't worked with Shopify before

- Are new to freelancing or e-commerce

- Can't commit to 8 AM - 5 PM CET full-time

- Have childcare or other major interruptions during work hours

- Prefer to work "your way" instead of following established systems

- Are uncomfortable giving direct, honest feedback about problems

- Only want part-time, sporadic, or project-based work



DO Apply If You...



- Have solid Shopify and e-commerce experience

- Have worked as a freelancer/VA before and know how to self-manage

- Are brutally honest when something isn't working

- Can follow detailed SOPs while thinking critically

- Want stable, full-time work with growth potential

- Are available European business hours with reliable setup

- See feedback as improvement, not criticism

- Want to be part of a no-BS, results-focused team





We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for experienced, honest, and reliable.

If you know e-commerce, can follow (and improve) processes, and aren't afraid to speak up - we want to hear from you.

We are building a stronger marketing function to grow inbound leads, increase brand authority, and better support our sales team. To support this, we are hiring a Marketing Coordinator to execute our marketing plan and run day-to-day marketing operations.



This is a hands-on, execution-focused role. You will be responsible for publishing content, managing marketing systems, coordinating campaigns, and tracking performance across our website,
, and social channels.



You will work closely with the Head of Growth and CEO to turn marketing priorities into consistent, measurable output.

This role is ideal for someone who is organised, detail-oriented, comfortable with digital tools, and enjoys seeing campaigns through from idea to execution.

title: Content Feedback Manager (Giving Feedback): $1,000–$1,200 USD START RATE
description:

Paid twice per month via Wise.



ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS

- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

TASKS

- Cross-reference each piece of content with client niche, experience, and goals as outlined in their files

- Review previous feedback to ensure consistency and avoid contradictions

- Be tough but fair—only approve content that meets quality standards



Progress Tracking

- Attend daily tea
eting (mandatory, 3pm CET)

REQUIREMENTS (MUST-HAVE)

- C1+ English (written), with perfect grammar and clear, professional responses

- Significant experience creating or reviewing short-form content for Instagram Reels, TikTok, or YouTube Shorts

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Treat it as a LIVE interview with the Hiring Manager

- Have a professional background

BONUS SKILLS (NOT REQUIRED)



- Experience supporting creators and social media beginners, especially ages 45+

- Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT, CapCut, etc.

- Strong understanding of trends/strategy for Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts



WHY JOIN US?



- Start rate: $800 a month + performance-based bonuses (TOTAL: $1,000–$1,200 a month once trained)

Note: Senior CFMs earn $1,500+ after 6–12 months.

- Performance bonuses: Up to $400+ additional monthly based on:

- Quality and clarity of feedback

- Task completion and consistency

- Teamwork and responsibility

- Payments: Twice per month via Wise, direct to your bank

- Tools access: All tools/software fully covered

- Work-life balance: No graveyard shifts

- Professional growth: Frequent feedback and advanced training

#1: Your CV.

#5: Your portfolio (including examples of your feedback or video/content work).



Note: Messages that do not follow this format will NOT be reviewed.

title: Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

- Reconcile transactions across multiple payment platforms, including Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRM tools

- Manage accounts payable, ensuring all invoices are properly reviewed, recorded, and scheduled for payment

- Assist with invoice processing, ensuring all vendor invoices are accurately documented and match purchase orders where applicable

- Work closely with the CFO to provide up-to-date financial records for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

- Ensure all financial data is accurate and properly organized to support compliance across multiple jurisdictions

- Flag discrepancies or unusual transactions for review by the CFO



What We’re Looking For

- At least 5 years of experience in bookkeeping and expense reconciliation

- Strong proficiency in Xero

- Experience working with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and custom CRMs

- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

- Experience handling multi-entity, multi-currency financial data preferred

- Comfortable working in a remote-first environment

- Fluent in English, both written and spoken



Requirements for Effective Remote Work

- Reliable computer or laptop capable of photo and video editing

- Stable high-speed internet connection

- Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

- Full-time opportunity

- Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)



Benefits

- Competitive pay

- Training and growth opportunities

- Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company



Salary range

- Php 40,000 - Php 65,000 (based on experience)



Application Instructions

Since this is a long-term position, there will be an in-depth qualification process. If you believe you have what it takes, here is what to do next:



Please go to the link below, review the questions carefully, and share the required information.

 


 

If you believe you meet our qualifications and requirements, we encourage you to apply now and become a valuable part of our rapidly expanding company.

title: Top 1% Direct Response Video Editor (VSL + UGC) - Full Time + Bonuses
description:
We are a fast-growing DTC Health brand looking for a creative Video Editor who understands Direct Response Marketing.



We don't just want "pretty" videos. We want high-converting creative that stops the scroll and gets people to buy. If your videos perform well and make us money, you will earn significant performance bonuses on top of your salary.



The Role (Read Carefully):

You will not just be "editing" clips we send you. You will be responsible for visually building the story.



Edit High-Converting VSLs & Ads: Creating long-form VSLs and short-form 
 ads for
 and Instagram.



Source Your Own Footage: You must be a "hunter." You will need to find stock footage, rip clips from the internet, and source b-roll that fits the script. You will not be spoon-fed every single clip.



Create Assets with AI: You must be proficient in using the latest AI tools (Nano Banana, Veo 3, Kling AI, Midjourney, ElevenLabs) to generate custom images, videos, and voiceovers when stock footage isn't enough.



Visual Storytelling: You understand pacing, hooks, pattern interrupts, and how to keep retention high.



Who You Are:



Experienced: You have edited VSLs or Direct Response ads before. When you apply please give us the proof as well.



Resourceful: You don't ask "where is the file?" -> You find a solution or create it yourself.



Tech Savvy: You are obsessed with AI video. You know how to prompt Veo 3 and Kling AI to get realistic movement.



Fast & Reliable: You can turn around high-quality edits quickly.



Software Requirements:



Adobe Premiere Pro / After Effects (or CapCut for short form if high quality).



AI Tools: Nano Banana, Veo 3, Kling AI. Provided by us if necessary.



How To Apply:

To be considered, you must follow these steps. Generic applications will be deleted.



Subject Line: Put "AI VIDEO BEAST" in the subject line of your application.



Portfolio: Send a link to your best VSL or Direct Response Ad (Google Drive or Portfolio link). Do not send cinematic travel vlogs or wedding videos. We want to see sales videos.



AI Experience: Briefly explain your workflow using Kling AI or Veo 3.



Sourcing: If we gave you a script about "gut health" but gave you no footage, how would you create the visuals? 



We are hiring immediately. Good luck!

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

Document Preparation & Writing

s, memos, presentations, and decks

Expense & Administrative Support

Travel Arrangements

Sales Support

We need someone who shows up, communicates clearly, and takes ownership.



???? WORK HOURS



Tuesday to Saturday, 1:00 PM – 10:00 PM (Singapore time)

This ensures smooth coordination with our Singapore-based team.



???? OUR COMPANY CULTURE



We live by five core values that define everything we do:

 with the subject line: “Personal Executive Assistant” and include clear answers to ALL of the following:

???? READY TO GROW WITH US?



If you’re seeking long-term stability, a positive and structured team culture, and the chance to grow in a meaningful role — we’d love to hear from you.



Apply now and become part of a company that values excellence, growth, and integrity.

Terry Lim

HR Manager

title: CPA/Bookkeeper
description:
About the Role

We are looking for a detail-oriented Certified Public Accountant (CPA) who is not afraid to roll up their sleeves and handle full-cycle bookkeeping. This is not just a data-entry role; we need a financial partner who can manage our entire set of books in QuickBooks Online, handle complex journal entries, and produce accurate, high-level financial reporting every month.

If you are a CPA who excels at maintaining clean books, managing month-end closes, and generating financial insight, we want to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities



1. Full-Cycle Bookkeeping & General Ledger Management

Manage day-to-day accounting operations in QuickBooks Online (QBO).

Prepare and post standard and complex journal entries (accruals, deferrals, depreciation, etc.).Perform weekly bank and credit card reconciliations to ensure all transactions are captured accurately.

Maintain the Chart of Accounts and ensure proper classification of expenses and revenue.2. Financial Reporting & Analysis

Prepare and generate monthly financial statements, including Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statements.

Provide variance analysis and financial commentary on monthly results.

Ensure all reporting is GAAP/IFRS compliant (as applicable).3. Month-End & Year-End Close

Own the "Close Ends" process: Strict adherence to month-end closing timelines.

Review general ledger accounts for errors and omissions before closing the books.

Assist with year-end financial preparation and tax-ready reporting.



Requirements



Education/Certification: Must be a licensed CPA (Certified Public Accountant).Software Expertise: Advanced proficiency in QuickBooks Online is non-negotiable. You must know how to navigate QBO efficiently.

Experience: 3+ years of hands-on experience in full-cycle accounting, bookkeeping, and financial reporting.

Technical Skills: Strong understanding of debits/credits, journal entries, and accounting principles.

Soft Skills: Excellent attention to detail, strong English communication skills (written and verbal), and the ability to work independently without micromanagement.



Why Join Us?

Competitive Pay: Monthly salary of $2,000 USD

Stability: Long-term remote position with a growing business.

Autonomy: We trust you to manage the books and reporting processes.



***Very Important: Do take note that the applicant is required to share their updated CV with appropriate access. Applicants who are non compliant with this will be automatically ignored.***

title: Australian Commercial Solar Admin Specialist
description:
We are seeking an Australian Commercial Solar Admin Specialist with hands-on experience in Australian commercial solar projects (30 kW and above).



This role focuses on post-sale administration, approvals, compliance, and documentation for commercial solar and solar + battery projects. Once onboarded, you will be trusted to manage jobs independently within defined processes.



This role is not suitable for general VAs or candidates without direct Australian solar experience.



Key Responsibilities:



1. Commercial Solar Administration

- Manage DNSP grid connection applications for commercial solar systems (30 kW+)

- Prepare and submit pre-approval applications

- Respond to DNSP technical queries and requests for additional information

- Manage export limits, zero-export requirements, and protection conditions

- Upload and manage documentation across DNSP portals



2. Solar + Battery Projects

- Support commercial battery approvals and documentation

- Ensure batteries are included correctly in DNSP approvals and SLDs

- Manage commissioning evidence and compliance documentation

- Coordinate with installers to resolve approval or documentation gaps



3. Compliance & Documentation

Review and manage:

  - Single Line Diagrams (SLDs)

  - CEC-compliant documentation

  - Installer and designer accreditation evidence

  - Commissioning photos and reports

Prepare STC documentation for commercial systems

Package compliance folders for audit readiness



Coordination & Communication

Liaise with:

    - Australian installers and electricians

    - STC traders

    - Retailers and DNSPs (via
 and portals)

Track job status, approvals, and outstanding actions

Flag risks, delays, or compliance issues early and escalate appropriately



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)



Candidates must have:

- Direct experience working with Australian solar companies

- Experience supporting commercial solar systems (30 kW+)

- Hands-on experience with at least one of the following:

- Grid connection applications

- STCs for commercial solar

- Australian DNSP portals



A solid understanding of:

- Export limits and DNSP pre-approval requirements

- Solar + battery integration fundamentals

- Clean Energy Council (CEC) compliance frameworks



Essential:

Victorian solar experience, including exposure to Victorian DNSPs such as:

    - Powercor

    - AusNet

    - Jemena

    - United Energy

- Experience across multiple Australian states (VIC, NSW, QLD)

- Experience managing commercial metering coordination

- Familiarity with CRMs such as Pylon, OpenSolar, ServiceM8, or similar

- Experience supporting mid-to-high volume solar installers



*Candidates without Australian solar experience should not apply.*



Why Join Us

*Work with a team that truly understands the solar industry.

*Remote role with Australia time zone working hours.

*Supportive environment with ongoing training and growth opportunities.

*Be part of a business that’s powering Australia’s renewable energy industry — behind the scenes.



About Percy Solar

Percy Solar is a specialist Australian solar administration and operations partner. We support solar installers by managing complex post-sale admin including grid connections, compliance, STCs, batteries, and customer coordination.



We are not a general VA agency.



We operate as a plug-and-play solar admin function, taking ownership of solar admin end-to-end so installers can focus on sales and installs.



We are expanding into commercial and industrial solar projects and are building a specialist offshore team with real Australian solar experience.

title: Senior GoHighLevel Engineer & Architect (LONG TERM OPPORTUNITY)
description:
Do not apply if you are new to GoHighLevel. I am looking for advanced experts.



I am launching a new SaaS Agency on the GoHighLevel platform. I am already proficient in GHL myself (I can build workflows, sites, and triggers), but I am looking for an Architect who is faster, smarter, and more technical than I am.



I need a long-term Technical Partner. If you prove yourself on the initial build, I want you to manage the entire technical backend of the agency as we scale to $50k/mo. You will help build and refine the product. I am looking for a proactive individual who will take lead and come up with improvements without being instructed to do so. I want you to bring your expertise to help grow this business. 





The Project (Immediate Scope)

I have a detailed technical scope ready for you, but here is the summary:



- You will be building the "Factory," not just one product.

- Build the funnels and site for our own agency

- Agency Backend Compliance: You must handle the A2P 10DLC Registration, UK Regulatory Bundles (Twilio), and SaaS Rebilling setup. If you don't know what any of this means, do not apply.

- Snapshot Architecture: You will build a "Standard" and "Premium" snapshot in a sandbox environment. You must understand how to use Custom Values for everything so deployment is instant.

- The "Hollywood" Demo Account: You will build a demo environment populated with fake leads, fake conversations, and fake revenue data. I need to be able to log in and demo the software live without setting it up.





Requirements:

Speed: I value results, not hours. If you can build this in just 2 days perfectly, I will pay you the full project fee.



English: Must be 100% fluent. You will be writing some of the
 copy in the workflows, and I will need your assistance with the first initial demos and sales calls



Timezone: Flexible, but you must be willing to join a few sales calls during UK/Europe Afternoon hours just as we get started 



Compensation:

Project Fee: Negotiable (High budget for the right expert).



Long-Term: Opportunity for a monthly retainer + profit share on setup fees for the right partner.





THE "EXPERT" TEST (REQUIRED)

Please answer answer these 4 technical scenarios in your application. If you skip these, I will delete your application.



Q1. I plan to sell this snapshot to 100 plumbers. I do NOT want to manually edit 50
s and SMS templates for every new client to change the "Booking Link" and "Business Name.". How do you structure the snapshot to ensure I only have to fill out one form during onboarding to update every workflow instantly?



Q2. I have a workflow with a "Wait 24 Hours Before Appointment" reminder. If a lead books an appointment for today at 2:00 PM (only 3 hours from now), what happens when they hit that "Wait 24 Hours Before" step? How do you ensure they still get the "1 Hour Before" reminder without getting stuck?



Q3.I want to run a Database Reactivation campaign on a list of 2,000 old leads. If I dump all 2,000 leads into the "SMS Offer" workflow at once, my Twilio number will get blocked for spam. How do you configure the workflow (or bulk action) to automatically drip feed these messages at a safe rate (e.g., 50 per day) without me doing it manually?



Q4. Explain to me why building workflows directly inside the main Agency Sub-Account is a bad idea for future updates. How would you structure it instead?



Thank you for your time

title: Bookkeeper - Australian (Xero & BAS Expert)
description:
Part-Time Australian Bookkeeper (Xero & BAS Expert)  8- 10 hours/week to start.



Job Description:

 - We are a growing group of businesses based in South Australia (including a multi-site health hub and a specialized property business) looking for a meticulous, Australian-experienced Bookkeeper to join our team part-time.



 - This is a long-term role for someone who is highly organized and can work independently to keep our accounts "audit-ready" at all times. As we grow, so too will you and your hours (if thats what you're looking for)



Bookkeeping & Compliance:

 - Set up & customize Xero for our businesses

 - Bank & credit card reconciliation — ensuring clean and accurate books

 - BAS & IAS preparation support

 - Accounts Receivable – invoicing, tracking, and follow-ups

 - End-of-month closing and reporting



Payroll Management (Australia):

 - Process payroll for permanent staff & contractors

 - Calculate PAYG withholding and superannuation

 - Manage employee leave and entitlements

 - Ensure ATO compliance and timely submissions



Financial Reporting & Insights:

 - Prepare Profit & Loss and Balance Sheet

 - Cash flow tracking and management

 - Highlight areas to reduce costs and improve profitability



You will work with.. 

 - Xero (with Hubdoc and Dext)

 - Microsoft Excel



Core Responsibilities:

Xero Management: Full oversight of Xero files for multiple small entities.



Bank Reconciliation: Daily/weekly reconciliation of high-volume transactions.



Accounts Payable/Receivable: Managing bills, reconciling supplier statements, and occasional debtor follow-ups.



Payroll & STP: Processing weekly/fortnightly payroll, including Single Touch Payroll (STP) filing and Superannuation Guarantee (SG) calculations.



BAS/IAS Preparation: Preparing draft Business Activity Statements and Installment Activity Statements for Accountant review.



Financial Reporting: Generating monthly P&L and Balance Sheet reports.

Credit Card reconcilliations

Forward tax planning calculations



Required Skills & Experience:

AU Experience is Mandatory: You must have at least 2 years of experience working specifically with Australian clients and understand GST, BAS, and ATO compliance.

Xero ProAdvisor, Xero Payroll Certified – for smooth setup and management

Detail-Oriented & Reliable – accuracy is our top priority

Clear Communication – we want a close relationship with you, so accurate, but also happy communication is key

End-to-End Bookkeeping Support – so we don’t have to worry about missed deadlines or compliance issues

Xero Certified: You must be a Xero expert (Xero Advisor Certification preferred).



Attention to Detail: You take pride in "clean" books and matching every cent.



Communication: Fluent written and spoken English.



Reliability: High-speed internet



Work Schedule:

Part-Time: Approximately 8 - 10 hours per week to start. Actual days will be by agreement and fit into your schedule.



Timezone: Flexible, but must be available for a 1-hour overlap with Adelaide (ACDT) business hours for communication.



How to Apply:

To ensure you have a high attention to detail, please start your application with the phrase: "I am a Xero Expert for Australia."



Please include in your application:



A brief summary of your experience with Australian Payroll and BAS.



A screenshot of your internet speed test.



Your availability (days/hours per week).

title: Multimedia Designer
