title: Amazon Client Success Manager (Full-Service Amazon Agency)
description:
About Us



We are a growing Amazon-focused agency working primarily with supplement brands in the US market. We provide full-service Amazon growth including PPC management, listing optimization, creative coordination, catalog management, and strategic guidance.



We are building a structured, professional team and are looking for a full-time Client Success Manager to help manage client relationships and coordinate internal execution.



This is a long-term role with strong growth potential.



Role Overview



As our Amazon Client Success Manager, you will be the main point of contact for assigned clients. You will coordinate between our PPC, creative, and operations teams to ensure smooth execution and clear communication.



You are not expected to execute PPC campaigns or create designs. Your role is to manage workflow, ensure quality, and maintain client satisfaction.



You must be confident communicating with US-based clients via Zoom and
.



Key Responsibilities



- Client Communication

- Lead weekly client updates

- Host and lead Zoom calls with clients

- Send performance summaries and action plans

- Manage client expectations professionally



Account Coordination



- Review account performance weekly

- Assign tasks to PPC, creative, and operations teams

- Ensure deadlines are met

- Follow internal SOPs

- Performance Monitoring

- Understand and interpret Amazon KPIs (ACOS, TACOS, ROAS, CVR, CTR, etc.)

- Identify performance drops and escalate when needed

- Prepare structured weekly and monthly reports



Quality Assurance



- Review listing updates before they are submitted

- Ensure creatives match briefs

- Ensure PPC updates follow strategy

-

Internal Collaboration



- Work closely with manager and department specialists

- Participate in weekly internal meetings

- Help improve systems and workflows



Required Qualifications



- 2+ years experience working with Amazon Seller Central accounts

- Experience working with US-based brands

- Strong written and spoken English

- Comfortable leading Zoom calls

- Experience preparing performance reports

- Strong organizational skills

- Ability to manage multiple accounts at once

- Familiarity with PPC terminology



Preferred



- Agency experience

- Experience managing 5+ Amazon accounts simultaneously

- Experience with supplements or health products

- Experience using ClickUp, Asana, or similar tools



What This Role Is NOT



- This is not a PPC specialist role.

- This is not a graphic design role.

- This is not a product research role.



This is a client-facing coordination and management position.



Work Details



- Full-time (40 hours per week)

- Remote

- Must overlap at least 4 hours with US business hours

- Long-term position



Growth Opportunity



- As the agency grows, this role can evolve into Senior Account Manager and eventually Head of Client Success.



- We are building a long-term team.



How To Apply (IMPORTANT)



- Send your resume

- use term "Success" in subject line

- Please answer the following questions carefully in your message:

    - Explain the difference between ACOS and TACOS.

    - If a client’s sales dropped 30% week-over-week, what steps would you take before speaking with them?

    - How would you structure a weekly client performance update?

    - How many Amazon accounts have you managed at one time?

    - Have you led Zoom calls with clients? Describe your experience.

    - What tools have you used to manage Amazon accounts?

    - Why are you interested in this role?

title: Social Media Video Editor for Engaging Reels
description:
Expert Social Media Video Editor for Engaging Short-Form Content (Reels, TikToks)



Company Overview

We are a growing brand looking to expand our social media presence through compelling and high-energy video content. We are seeking a creative and skilled video editor to partner with us in creating engaging reels that capture attention, tell our story, and drive audience growth. If you are passionate about social media trends and have a knack for creating viral-worthy content, we want to hear from you!



Job Description

We are looking for a talented and experienced Video Editor to join our team on a project basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for editing raw video footage into polished, engaging, and on-brand social media reels (Instagram Reels and TikTok). You will be working with a variety of footage to create short-form videos that are fast-paced, visually appealing, and optimized for maximum engagement.



This is a remote, freelance position with compensation on a per-video basis.



Key Responsibilities

• Edit raw video footage into engaging 15-90 second social media videos.

• Incorporate graphics, text overlays, split screens, and other dynamic elements to enhance storytelling.

• Apply modern video editing techniques and stay up-to-date with the latest social media trends.

• Ensure all videos align with our brand identity, style, and tone.

• Add captions, music, and sound effects to create a complete and immersive viewing experience.

• Collaborate with our team to understand project goals and deliver content that meets our objectives.

• Manage and organize video files and project assets.



What We're Looking For: The Principles of Engagement

We are looking for an editor who understands the science behind engaging social media video. Your editing style should reflect the following principles:

• Rapid Pacing: You understand that attention spans are short. Your edits will feature quick cuts, with a new visual element or change of pace every 1-3 seconds to maintain viewer momentum.

• Strong Hooks: You know how to grab attention within the first 3 seconds of a video with a compelling visual, a bold statement, or an intriguing question.

• Dynamic Visuals: You are proficient in using a variety of techniques to keep the viewer engaged, including:

• Lists and Graphics: Using on-screen text and graphics to present information in a clear and visually appealing way.

• Split Screens: Effectively using split screens for comparisons, reactions, or multi-angle storytelling.

• Motion and Zoom: Using subtle zooms, pans, and motion graphics to guide the viewer's focus.

• Narrative Flow: You can structure a video with a clear beginning (setup), middle (payoff), and end (reward), even in a short format.

• Trend Integration: You are constantly aware of the latest trends on Instagram Reels and TikTok and can creatively incorporate them into our content.



Required Skills and Qualifications

• Proven experience as a video editor, with a strong portfolio of social media videos (Reels, TikToks).

• Proficiency in professional video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, CapCut).

• A keen eye for detail and a strong understanding of visual storytelling, pacing, and rhythm.

• Ability to work independently, manage your time effectively, and meet deadlines.

• Excellent communication skills and a collaborative spirit.

• A deep understanding of the social media landscape and what makes content go viral.



Compensation



We offer a competitive rate of $5 - $15 USD per completed video, depending on the complexity and length of the project. We are looking for a long-term partnership with the right candidate.



How to Apply



We have a two-step application process designed to find the best fit for our team.



Step 1: Initial Application



Please submit the following:



1.

Your resume or a summary of your experience.



2.

A link to your portfolio or a collection of your best work. Please highlight 2-3 examples of social media reels that you are most proud of and explain why.



Step 2: Paid Test Project



Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a paid test project. We will provide you with a small package of raw footage and a creative brief. This will allow us to see your skills in action and how you interpret our brand. You will be compensated for this test project, regardless of the outcome.



We are excited to see your work and potentially welcome you to our team!

title: AI Senior Video Editor for 7 figure supplement brands (Sora 2, Kling, Heygen, and more).
description:
*IMPORTANT* This is a premium post for experienced editors with intermediate/expert knowledge of AI generation for advertisements. AI is evolving everyday so we need someone who’s CONSTANTLY learning. Please read the post in its entirety, only top tier applicants will be considered. 





Job Description:

Position: Senior Video Editor

Type: Remote, Long-Term High-Volume Contract

Compensation: This is a high-paying opportunity based on a consistent, high-volume workload. The fixed rate is $10-$20 USD (flexible) per 2-5 minute video with options for bonuses in future possible depending on the quality of the videos.



If you can’t make AI B-Roll and fast pace editing like this, THIS JOB IS NOT FOR YOU. Here’s an example of various ad formats we use:


 



WHO ARE WE?

Hello everyone, 

I’m the CEO & founder of a fast growing direct response E-commerce holding company, currently doing $1mm per month with our own in-house supplement brands that we started from scratch. 



We’re looking to hire a Senior video editor who can bring our visions for creatives to life, specifically using realistic style AI to generate content using tools such as Sora 2, Veo 3, Kling, Higgsfield or others… an example of an ad generated with full Sora AI B-roll is this here: 
 


 

The majority of the video is generated here with AI b-roll in order to bring the story to life. We will provide you with any tools you need but ideally we’d want someone very knowledgeable with AI and Sora video generation as that’s what seems to be performing the best. 



We want someone who’ll be constantly curious on how to edit and increase their skills as a whole. This won’t be as simple as just editing videos since you will be essentially generating B-roll for these personal stories yourself. 



This is a role with real growth potential and longevity for someone looking to grow their skills in a healthy work environment. With potential to evolve into a senior creative operations leader earning above market. We value creativity and will reward people who grow with the company. 





WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

- Unlimited growth opportunity without pay ceiling 

- Long term work, unlike most dropshippers & e-commerce brand owners, all of our brands are long term with subscriptions where we intend for them to be around forever. So you’ll always have work with us in our ecosystem and we’ll only grow more from here. 

- $15,000+ worth of training material and SOPs from various programs like ecomtalent, evolve, advertorial mastery, VSL masterclass and more… 



WHAT WE EXPECT?

- High Output: We scale fast so no “free riders” or 9-5 mindsets for this job role, payment is per video.

- Quality over Quantity: We expect consistent production of ads, we’re fine with giving extended times for production but we need you to make up for delays in quality,

- Curiosity & personal growth *IMPORTANT*: We want you to consistently be looking at ads from competitors and other top brands in the niche. At the company we go by a motto of “sharpening your sword” with consistent work to become the best. 



HOW TO APPLY? (via. onlinejobs)

Step 1. Send me videos you’ve made in the past utilizing AI

Step 2. Send me videos of clips/b-rolls you’ve generated using AI, for example: 
 

Step 3. Send me the hours & days you’re available for editing and if you have any other jobs you’re doing currently



FINAL Step, If your resume seems good, we will ask for a PAID sample to confirm your skills. The payment for the sample will be added to your first paycheck (next Friday, then every 2 weeks). 



Thank you for reading this application, I look forward to working with the best of the best!

Cheers

title: Social Media & Content Manager: Health, Wellness & Manufacturing
description:
We are looking for a Social Media & Content Manager who understands that "good content" is the ultimate Trojan horse for a brand. We operate in the high-growth supplement and contract manufacturing sectors, and we need someone who can distinguish between a hard-sell ad and a piece of content that provides genuine value, education, or entertainment.



Your goal is to build authority and trust at the Top of Funnel so that by the time a user sees one of our ads, they already know, like, and trust us.



### Key Responsibilities

Content vs. Creative Strategy: You must understand the nuance between "Disruptive Ads" (paid) and "Magnetic Content" (organic). You will focus on the latter—creating "edutainment" around supplements and manufacturing that builds a long-term audience.



Supplement Niche Expertise: Create content that simplifies complex health topics (health, recovery, and performance) into digestible social bites. You'll be responsible for making "boring" manufacturing processes look fascinating to potential B2B and B2C clients.



AI-Enhanced Workflow: Leverage AI tools (ChatGPT, Midjourney, etc.) to research health trends, script video hooks, and generate high-fidelity visual concepts at scale.



Canva Mastery: Design professional, clean, and trustworthy brand assets. In the supplement world, "design equals trust"—you will be responsible for maintaining that high standard across all platforms.



Multi-Channel Management: Lead the narrative across TikTok, Instagram,
, and LinkedIn, tailoring the tone for each (e.g., "Hacks" for TikTok vs. "Industry Authority" for LinkedIn).



### The "Non-Negotiables"

The "Value-First" Mindset: You know that a video explaining why a specific ingredient works is often more effective for organic growth than a "10% off" graphic.



Direct Response Foundations: Even though you are creating "content," you understand the principles of direct response—strong hooks, clear calls to value, and psychological triggers.



Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in Canva and a suite of AI productivity tools. You should be comfortable using AI to multiply your output, not replace your creativity.



Health/Supplement Interest: An interest in the health and wellness space is vital. You should be able to speak the language of "recovery," "biohacking," and "wellness" authentically.



E-commerce Savvy: Experience with Shopify and an understanding of how social content feeds into a larger e-commerce ecosystem.



### Why This Role?

You will be at the heart of our brand-building engine. You’ll have the opportunity to work on the "front lines" of our consumer-facing supplement brands and the "behind-the-scenes" of our manufacturing arms. We are a results-oriented team that values speed, clear communication, and the ability to distinguish "noise" from "signal."

title: IT Technical Support Engineer - Permanent WFH Remote, Flexible Hours (+10 GMT)
description:
*** DO NOT APPLY UNTIL YOU HAVE READ THIS AD IN FULL ***



Amigo Technology is an IT service business and Managed Service Provider (MSP), located on the Sunshine Coast, Australia. We have been operating for 16 years, with the goal of making computers and technology friendlier to our awesome small business clients. We are seeking a Technical IT service officer to join our friendly team via a permanent, work-from-home arrangement. Here’s a few words from our founder: youtu.be/2hz3OBT-lPg



By joining the Amigo team, you will enjoy:



- A flexible work from home position, up to 40 hours per week, on a schedule that works for you

- Unlimited access to our internal virtual lab, mentoring and training programs, where you will get to experience the latest and greatest technologies with a strong emphasis on open source systems

- Plenty of hands-on time with workstations, servers, networking and cybersecurity projects

- A friendly team atmosphere where you’ll need a good sense of humour!

- Daily opportunities to help ordinary people with technology challenges in a team environment, with the goal of making technology friendly

- Competitive earnings, typically between 370php and 475php per hour, depending on ability and experience, plus bonuses



Ready to join? Here’s what you’ll need:



- A keen interest in working with and growing your skill sets through a wide variety of modern computing technologies (both Windows and Linux - bonus points if you have a home lab!)

- A high level of attention to detail (you must put the word "AMIGO" in the “Additional Comments” section of our application form to be considered)

- At least two years of experience working in an IT service position, ideally in an MSP that works with Windows 11, Microsoft 365 OR Google Workspace environments



This position will have many opportunities for growth, and over time you will have to encourage you to work with a wider range of technologies and platforms. Prior experience with the following would be greatly appreciated and will lead to greater earnings, although this is not a requirement:



- Debian-based Linux (eg. Linux Mint 22 / Ubuntu 24.04 or newer)

- Apple MacOS 13+

- Proxmox 8+ & Docker (or other hypervisor / virtualisation platforms)

- Small business networking and storage systems (eg. Opnsense, OpenWrt, Cockpit), including configuring Wi-Fi, DHCP, QOS, VLANs, VPNs, Samba, ZFS RAID, etc

- FreePBX 16+ / Asterisk, IP Phones & SIP



Your duties will include the following:



- Processing technical support requests, enquiries and system alerts

- Providing remote IT services via RMM & IP KVMs

- Assisting with new and existing IT systems, including setting up, migrating, monitoring, documenting and securing technical systems, such as workstations, servers and cloud-based infrastructure



If you have made it this far, great! Before you apply:



- You will be expected to learn quickly and contribute as part of a team. The workload will be both challenging and rewarding.

- We conduct background checks and our team is required to use managed remote workstations. Dishonest conduct will be quickly caught. If you’re thinking of using a mouse jiggler or being OE, please don’t apply.

- Applicants MUST submit their application via our application form, which can be found on the Amigo Technology Sunshine Coast website via the Careers section in the top menu. All other application methods will be IGNORED. 
/form-technical-officer-application



Please double check the responses to your resume to ensure they are correct - over 90% of applicants fail to submit their application with correct answers. We will only contact valid submissions. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: YouTube Video Editor
description:
We create well-researched, engaging YouTube videos about travel safety, digital nomad life, and navigating international travel.

Our audience: Digital nomads, frequent international travelers, and people planning major moves abroad.

Our content: Educational videos that help people travel smarter and safer — covering topics like avoiding scams, digital security, travel gear, and real-world travel experiences.



This is YouTube educational content editing, a specific craft that requires:

> Strong storytelling through pacing and B-roll

> Understanding of viewer retention and engagement

> Ability to make 10-15 minute videos feel fast and valuable

> Balancing information density with watchability

> Making one person talking to a camera feel dynamic and interesting

If you understand that editing IS storytelling, and you know how to keep YouTube viewers watching.



What You'll Do For Each Video



1. Review the Package

You'll receive a complete production package from our Content Coordinator:

> Raw footage (A-roll of host speaking)

> Organized B-roll references and source files

> Script with timestamps and key 
nts

> Production brief with specific requirements

> Sponsor integration notes (if applicable)

> Brand assets and templates



Your first task: Review everything and flag any gaps or questions immediately.



2. Build the Story

This is where your editorial judgment matters most.

You'll:

> Watch all raw footage and identify the best takes

> Cut out mistakes, dead space, and low-energy 
nts

> Find the natural rhythm and pacing

> Structure the narrative flow

> Remove filler words strategically (keep it natural, not robotic)

> Create smooth transitions between topics

> Maintain energy throughout the video



3. Add Visual Interest

This is what separates good YouTube editing from basic cutting.

You'll:

> Integrate B-roll that supports what's being said (not random filler)

> Add text overlays for key points and emphasis

> Include screenshots, graphics, or reference images

> Source additional B-roll from stock sites when needed (accounts provided)

> Create visual variety so it's not just a talking head

> Use graphics and text to reinforce important information

> Ensure every visual serves a purpose

Think of B-roll as visual punctuation; it emphasizes, clarifies, and keeps viewers engaged.



4. Polish Audio & Add Music 

You'll:

> Clean up audio inconsistencies

> Remove background noise

> Balance audio levels between sections

> Add background music appropriately (not constantly, not overwhelming)

> Ensure sponsor segments are clean and professional

>Check for audio sync issues

> Make sure nothing is jarring or distracting



5. Final Polish & Export

You'll:

> Add intro/outro using provided templates

> Integrate sponsor segments seamlessly

> Apply color correction for consistency

> Do final pacing check

> Watch the full video as a viewer would

> Export according to YouTube specs

> Deliver via agreed method (Google Drive, 
, etc.)



6. Incorporate Feedback & Deliver Final 

You'll:

> Review feedback comments in 

> Make requested changes

> Ask clarifying questions if notes are unclear

> Submit revised version

> Make any final tweaks

> Export and deliver final version



You're Perfect for This If You:



You understand YouTube editing specifically

> You know YouTube pacing is different from film, TV, or corporate video

> You understand what keeps viewers watching vs. what makes them click away

> You've edited content that holds attention for 10+ minutes

> You know when to cut tight vs. when to let 
nts breathe

> You understand jump cuts, pacing variety, and engagement techniques



You have strong editorial judgment

> You can watch raw footage and see the story hiding inside

> You know what to keep and what to cut

> You make content more engaging without changing the message

> You don't over-edit or make everything feel frenetic

> You can match the right pacing to the right content type



You're technically proficient

> You're an expert in your editing software (Premiere, Final Cut, or DaVinci)

> You understand audio mixing and cleanup

> You can do color correction and grading

> You know how to work with various file formats

> You understand YouTube's technical requirements

> You can solve technical problems independently



You work efficiently under deadlines

> You can estimate how long edits will take

> You meet deadlines reliably

> You don't get lost in perfectionism

> You balance quality with realistic timelines

> You communicate proactively if you're blocked



You collaborate professionally

> You take feedback as collaboration, not criticism

> You ask questions when direction is unclear

> You communicate clearly about challenges

> You're responsive during the project timeline

> You deliver what you promise, when you promise it



You maintain consistent quality

> Your work doesn't vary wildly between projects

> You have professional standards and stick to them

> You don't cut corners when you're busy

> You take pride in every video you deliver



Required Background & Skills



Must Have:

Editing experience

>Minimum 3 years of professional video editing

> YouTube content editing experience (not just social media shorts)

> Portfolio showing 10-15 minute educational or informational videos

> Proven ability to maintain viewer engagement through editing



Software proficiency

> Expert level in at least one: Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve

> Comfortable with audio editing software (Audition or equivalent)

> Basic motion graphics ability (text animation, simple graphics)

> Understanding of color correction and grading



Technical knowledge

> Understanding of video codecs and formats

> Knowledge of YouTube's technical requirements

> Experience with file management and organization

> Ability to troubleshoot technical issues



Communication & collaboration

> Fluent English (for understanding scripts and feedback)

> Professional communication skills

> Responsive within 3 hours during projects

> Clear about timeline and any challenges



Strongly Preferred:



Helpful experience:

> Travel or lifestyle content editing

> Educational or tutorial video editing

> Documentary-style content

> Working with solo content creators

> Remote editing work



Bonus skills:

> Motion graphics and animation

> Sound design expertise

> Advanced color grading

> Multiple software proficiencies

> Thumbnail creation



Content understanding:

> Interest in travel or digital nomad lifestyle

> Understanding of travel safety topics

> Experience with sponsored content integration

> Familiarity with affiliate marketing in YouTube content



Tools & Software



You must be expert-level proficient in:

> Adobe Premiere Pro (preferred), OR

> Final Cut Pro, OR

> DaVinci Resolve



You should be comfortable with:

> Adobe Audition or similar (audio editing)

> Photoshop or similar (basic graphics)

> 
 (review and collaboration platform)

> Google Drive (file sharing)

> Stock footage platforms (we provide accounts)



We provide:

> 
 account for review

> Stock footage accounts (Storyblocks, Artgrid, etc.)

> Brand asset library

> Templates and style guides

> All necessary project files



You need:

> Professional editing computer capable of handling 4K footage

> Reliable high-speed internet

> Quiet workspace for occasional video calls

> Backup system for project files



How to Apply

Please submit a resume together with:



1. Brief introduction (
words)

Tell us:

> Your editing background and experience

> What type of content you most enjoy editing

> Why you're interested in this specific role

> Your preferred working arrangement (per-video vs. hourly)



2. Portfolio/work samples (REQUIRED)

Provide:

> Links to at least 3 full YouTube videos you've edited (10+ minutes each)

> Link to editing reel or showreel (if available)

> Note your specific role on each project

> If possible, include videos with performance metrics (views, retention, engagement)



3. Technical setup

Tell us:

> Your primary editing software and version

> Your computer specs (processor, RAM, GPU)

> Internet speed (include screenshot of speed test)

> Your location/time zone



4. Availability & rate

Confirm:

> Your available hours per week

> Your preferred payment structure (per-video or hourly)

> Your rate expectations based on experience

> How soon you could start



5. Reference check

Provide:

> At least one reference from a recent client (YouTube creator preferred)

> Contact information we can use to verify your work



6. Include the word "Atlas" in your subject line



If you're an editor who gets excited about retention curves, understands pacing intuitively, and takes pride in making the host look great — we want to hear from you.



If you're looking for flashy creative freedom or want to "put your stamp" on every project, this probably isn't the right fit. But if you get satisfaction from crafting content that works, engages, and serves its purpose — this could be perfect.



Ready to apply? Send your complete application to: 
 



We're reviewing applications on a rolling basis and will respond to qualified candidates within 5 business days.



Looking forward to seeing your work.

title: HR & Recruitment Manager (Recruitment & HR Operations)
description:
We are looking for an experienced HR & Recruitment Manager with a strong background as an HR Generalist to lead end-to-end recruitment while managing core HR functions. This role requires someone who can build strong talent pipelines, manage full-cycle hiring, and support overall HR operations including employee relations, performance management, training & development, compliance, and HR administration.



The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, and strategic, capable of improving HR processes, supporting leadership, and strengthening company culture while ensuring HR policies and procedures are properly implemented.





Responsibilities: 



Talent Acquisition & Recruitment Management

--Lead and oversee global recruitment operations, ensuring efficient coordination with HR/Admin teams and timely execution of hiring and HR processes.

--Lead end-to-end talent acquisition across Philippine and international markets, overseeing sourcing, screening, interviews, offer management, and pre-hire support for remote positions.

--Build and sustain strategic talent pipelines, utilizing advanced sourcing methods, market mapping, and salary benchmarking for niche and hard-to-fill positions.

--Align recruitment strategies with business objectives, partnering with department heads to implement structured, consistent, and data-driven hiring practices.

--Enhance employer branding and candidate experience, maintaining strong engagement, professional communication, and long-term pipeline relationships.

--Ensure recruitment compliance and operational excellence, maintaining ATS accuracy, tracking KPIs (time-to-fill, conversion rates, pipeline activity), and delivering performance reports to leadership.



Employee Relations

--Serve as point-person for employee concerns, conflict resolution, and workplace issues

--Handle employee investigations, mediation, and disciplinary processes fairly and consistently

--Coach managers on employee management best practices

--Ensure proper documentation and compliant handling of employee relations cases



Organizational Strategy

--Support organizational planning: workforce planning, structure development, role clarity, and manpower forecasting

--Create HR systems aligned with business goals and scaling needs

--Provide HR insights to leadership for decision-making and organization performance improvement



HR Compliance & Legal

--Ensure compliance with company policies and local labor regulations

--Prepare and maintain HR documentation: memos, i
 reports, disciplinary notices, and termination documents

--Update and improve HR policies, handbook, and SOPs as needed



HR Operations & Administration

--Maintain employee records and HR documentation (201 files, contracts, onboarding forms, etc.)

--Support HR reports and admin requirements (attendance monitoring, leave tracking, manpower reports)

--Coordinate with payroll/admin teams to ensure accurate employee data and timely processing

--Improve HRIS processes (employee data, tracking forms, onboarding templates, clearance records)

--Ensure HR documentation and payroll-related records are organized, secure, and updated



Engagement & Culture

--Lead or assist employee engagement programs and internal activities

--Support culture-building initiatives including recognition programs and communication strategies

--Implement initiatives that support retention, morale, and team alignment



HR Process Improvement

--Identify gaps and inefficiencies in recruitment and HR operations

--Develop and implement improved HR workflows, templates, and systems

--Create HR SOPs and tools for consistent execution across teams

--Track HR KPIs and recommend improvements based on data

--Use ClickUp to:

-Manage recruitment pipelines and task assignments

-Track HR operations, cases, and project timelines

-Implement HR dashboards, automation, templates, and checklists

-Monitor team deliverables and HR KPIs consistently

--Ensure HR processes are transparent, measurable, and consistently executed



Requirements: 

--Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business Administration, or related course

--5+ years of HR experience, with strong exposure as:

-Recruiter / Talent Acquisition

-HR Generalist handling core HR functions

--Proven ability to manage multiple hiring requirements while handling HR operations

--Strong knowledge of HR processes including:

-Recruitment & Selection

-Employee Relations

-Performance Management

-Training & Development

-HR Compliance

-HR Admin/Documentation

--Proficient in project management tools, preferably ClickUp for task tracking and collaboration.



Preferred Skills: 

--Experience managing an HR or recruitment team

--Experience handling company HR policies and documentation

--Exposure to HR reporting, HR tools, and HR systems

--Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office/Google Workspace

title: Senior Manager - E-Commerce (with leadership exp) - Remote
description:
Description

We are hiring a senior E-commerce Manager to own and manage the majority of our digital business. This role is ideal for someone with a strong small business background who is comfortable leading a lean team, managing day to day operations, and stepping into the details when needed.



This is a hands on leadership role. We are not looking for a high level executive who operates far from execution. We are looking for someone who can lead, manage, and do..



Company Brief:

We are supporting a privately owned company that distributes marine dock parts and supplies, with a strong and growing e-commerce operation in Florida. The business serves both B2B and B2C customers and relies heavily on its digital channels to drive sales, support customer experience, and scale efficiently across domestic and international markets.



Responsibilities

Owning the end to end e-commerce operation across Shopify as the primary platform

Managing and supporting the back office and digital team

Overseeing technical, operational, and day to day e-commerce activities

Acting as the main point of contact for agencies and third party vendors

Representing the company on technical, operational, and integration related calls

Managing product additions, integrations, customer service escalations, and platform issues

Ensuring the team is aligned, productive, and clear on priorities

Running regular check ins and one on ones with direct reports

Coordinating with in person staff as it relates to e-commerce operations

Communicating clearly with company owners on progress, issues, and priorities

Getting hands on when needed to resolve issues or unblock the team



Platforms and Experience Required

Strong expertise in Shopify is required

Experience with Amazon is strongly preferred

Exposure to Walmart or eBay is a plus but not required

Comfort managing integrations, apps, and technical workflows

Experience working with agencies and external partners



Requirements



Education & Experience



Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, E-commerce, or a related field is preferred

Minimum of 3 years of hands-on Shopify experience in a live e-commerce environment

Proven experience maintaining, optimizing, and troubleshooting Shopify stores

Experience managing or supporting marketplace platforms such as Amazon, Etsy, eBay and More

Background working in product-based or multi-channel e-commerce businesses

Strong understanding of end-to-end e-commerce operations and workflows

Comfortable working remotely and independently with minimal supervision

Able to manage day-to-day execution while overseeing team output and priorities

Ability to work fully during Eastern Standard Time business hours



Nice to Have Skills



Experience with additional marketplaces such as Walmart or other third-party platforms

Familiarity with e-commerce integrations, apps, and third-party tools

Basic understanding of e-commerce financials, including margins, pricing, and cost of goods

Experience coordinating with agencies or external vendors

Exposure to international e-commerce operations or cross-border selling

Comfortable supporting or overseeing digital marketing initiatives in partnership with specialists or agencies

Experience helping scale or integrate new brands or acquisitions into an existing e-commerce platform



Ideal Candidate Profile



Has managed a small to mid sized team (roughly 5–20 people)

Comes from a small business or growing company environment

Is comfortable wearing multiple hats

Can lead without being “too high level”

Is not afraid to get into the operational or technical details

Can grow with the company as we scale and potentially acquire other businesses



***Very important: Do take note that the applicant is required to share their updated CV with appropriate access. Applicants who are non compliant with this will be automatically ignored.***

title: Junior Business Analyst (Paid Internship ? Business Analyst I Promotion Track)
description:
Company: Quantum Arcadia Group

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Salary: ?10,000–?15,000/month (Probation) | ?25,000–?40,000/month upon Promotion



About Quantum Arcadia Group



Quantum Arcadia Group is a Private Equity & Geopolitics Firm operating across Europe, Asia, North America, and Oceania (Australia).



The firm is structured into seven specialized teams, each composed of 8–14 professionals operating under strict performance, accountability, and execution standards.



You are applying to join the firm’s newest team.



This team is led by our Principal Strategist, who holds full operational authority, including unilateral discretion to hire, discipline, or terminate personnel at any time based on performance, conduct, or business necessity.



Role Overview



We are hiring Junior Business Analysts, structured initially as a Paid Intern / Junior BA role for 3–6 months, with strong intention to promote qualified individuals to Business Analyst I thereafter.



This role is designed for serious, high-potential graduates seeking structured professional growth in a disciplined environment.



Compensation & Benefits



During 90-Day Probation:



?10,000–?15,000 monthly



Bi-weekly salary payments



Performance-based bonus eligibility



Upon Promotion to Business Analyst I:



?25,000–?40,000 monthly (based on performance and contribution)



Salary + performance-based bonuses



Paid holidays



Birthday leave (double pay)



Fully remote



Standard working hours



Compensation within the firm is performance-driven. Employees who demonstrate exceptional reliability, execution, and value creation may see compensation increases ranging from approximately 30% to as much as 150%, based solely on merit and business impact. Compensation growth is earned — never guaranteed.



Probation & Standards



All new hires are subject to an immediate 90-day probationary period.



During probation:



Flawless adherence to expectations is required



Any tardiness, unapproved absence, call-outs, or no-shows may result in immediate termination without notice



Performance is continuously evaluated



This is a professional, high-accountability environment. Reliability and discipline are non-negotiable.



Security & Information Access



Certain areas of the firm are intentionally restricted for operational and security reasons. Access to systems, departments, or information is granted strictly on a need-to-know basis.



Lack of visibility should not be interpreted as an error. It is standard operating procedure.



Qualifications



Business-related academic background (Management, Economics, Finance, Political Science, Business Administration, etc.)



Recent graduate or graduating soon with immediate availability



Strong analytical thinking and structured problem-solving ability



High discipline, reliability, and attention to detail



Comfortable in high-pressure environments



Professional communication skills (written and verbal)



Long-term career-oriented mindset



What We Are Building



We are building a disciplined, professional, high-performance team with:



Clear growth pathways



Defined standards



Accountability



Merit-based advancement



This is an opportunity for individuals who want structure, standards, and accelerated growth — not comfort.

title: Freelance CAD Draftsman – California ADU Projects (Per Project / Remote) We are a U.S.-based real estate
description:

If you understand precision, clean layers, proper scaling, and California building standards — we want you.



???? Scope of Work

You will be responsible for producing permit-ready blueprint sets that can be reviewed and stamped by a California-based engineer before submission to city planning departments.



Deliverables include:

Site plan (with setbacks, easements, lot coverage, parking if required)



Floor plans (fully dimensioned)



Exterior elevations



Roof plan



Foundation plan (draft only – engineer will finalize)



Framing plan (draft only)



Door & window schedule



Title sheet & sheet index



Code summary (California Residential Code reference formatting)



All drawings must be:



Clean CAD layers



Proper line weights



Accurate measurements (feet/inches format)



To California drafting standards



Ready for engineer markup and stamp



???? Requirements

Strong experience with AutoCAD (required)



Experience drafting U.S. residential projects



Understanding of:



California Residential Code (CRC)



Setbacks, FAR, height limits



Title 24 coordination (basic understanding)



Ability to follow redlines from U.S. engineer



Fast turnaround (7–14 days typical per ADU)



Strong attention to detail — no sloppy scaling



Bonus if you:

Can produce clean PDF plan sets formatted for city submittal



Understand U.S. construction standards

title: Patient Booking & Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
FULL TIME ROLE — Are You Our Next Patient Booking & Marketing Automation Specialist?



About Earworx

Earworx is a purpose and values-driven Australian healthcare business committed to delivering safe, professional and connected care. We are growing rapidly and are looking for a high-performing, proactive Virtual Assistant to help optimise our patient booking systems and marketing automation.

This is a full-time, 100% virtual role working Australian (Hobart, Tasmania) business hours. You will play a key role in managing patient reactivation campaigns, marketing automation, and booking optimisation through our CRM systems.

Who We Are Looking For

• Aligned with our values: Safe. Professional. Connected. Always Improving.

• Highly organised with exceptional attention to detail.

• Comfortable working autonomously and being accountable for results.

• Confident using CRM systems (Go High Level experience highly regarded).

• Strong written English communication skills.

• Proactive, solutions-focused and systems-driven.

• Reliable internet connection and ability to work remotely full-time



Core Responsibilities & Outcomes

• Build and optimise marketing automation campaigns inside Go High Level (POD).

• Manage SMS reactivation and patient recall campaigns.

• Respond to and manage patient enquiries from marketing campaigns.

• Ensure accurate transfer and management of recall lists between systems.

• Track, report and improve campaign performance KPIs.

• Continuously optimise systems to improve booking conversion rates.

• Clear and responsive communication during working hours

• Create and update standard operating procedures

What Success Looks Like

• Consistent increase in bookings generated from marketing campaigns.

• High campaign accuracy and on-time execution.

• Strong conversion rates from recall and reactivation lists.

• Clear, professional and prompt communication with patients and tea
mbers.

• Ongoing system improvements that increase efficiency and performance.

Why Join Earworx?

You will join a supportive and professional healthcare team committed to excellence and continuous improvement. We value accountability, initiative and growth. This role offers long-term stability, structured systems, and the opportunity to directly contribute to patient care outcomes.



How to Apply

Please send your most current Resume and a brief cover letter and short 'Loom' video outlining how you can help improve patient bookings and marketing performance if you joined our Team and the experience that you will bring to us.

Important: Include the word “APPLICATION” in the subject line for your application to be reviewed.



We look forward to hearing from you.

The Earworx Team

title: AMAZON VIRTUAL ASSISTANT
description:
HIRING: PART-TIME AMAZON VIRTUAL ASSISTANT



Part-Time | 4 Hours/Day | 3 Days/Week (12 Hours Weekly)



Hello! I am hiring a reliable and detail-oriented Amazon Virtual Assistant to support my Amazon business.

ed/uploaded the same day it is completed

$5/hour

$240 per month

title: Client Relations / Customer Service Support (Remote - Night Shift)
description:
We specialize in providing tailored mortgage services to homebuyers and real estate professionals. Our goal is to build strong partnerships within the real estate industry to help clients secure the best mortgage options available. We are seeking a dedicated, personable, and results-driven Dialer to reach out to prospective clients and real estate agents, establish relationships, and promote our mortgage services.



Key Responsibilities:

• Client Outreach: Make outbound calls to prospective real estate agents and clients to introduce our mortgage services.

• Relationship Building: Develop and maintain strong, positive relationships with real estate agents, brokers, and clients.

• Service Promotion: Communicate the benefits of our mortgage services clearly and effectively to potential partners and clients.

• Lead Generation: Identify and qualify new leads from incoming inquiries or research and cold outreach.

• Application Intake: Take initial client applications and gather required information to prepare clients for the loan officer.

• Follow-Up: Track all interactions and schedule follow-up calls to ensure continued engagement with leads.

• Reporting: Maintain accurate records of calls, outcomes, and progress toward relationship-building goals.

• Team Collaboration: Work closely with the sales and loan officer teams to ensure smooth transitions and effective communication with clients.

________________________________________

Qualifications:

• Experience: Prior experience in telemarketing, customer service, or sales is a plus. Real estate or mortgage industry experience is highly desirable, but not required.

• Communication Skills: Excellent verbal communication skills with the ability to build rapport quickly.

• Attention to Detail: Ability to accurately capture client information and ensure smooth transition to loan officers.

• Self-Motivated: Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and stay organized in a remote setting.

• Goal-Oriented: Strong drive to achieve goals and contribute to the growth of the company.

• Tech-Savvy: Comfortable using CRM systems and other communication tools.

• Professionalism: Must be highly professional, reliable, and able to work in a fast-paced environment.

• C1 English Proficiency: Must have C1 level English proficiency (Advanced) or higher. This includes the ability to understand and produce detailed, complex communication in both spoken and written English.



________________________________________

What We Offer:

• Competitive base salary + performance-based commissions/bonuses.

• Flexible work hours and the ability to work remotely.

• Comprehensive training and ongoing support.

• Opportunity to grow within a dynamic and growing company.

• A collaborative and positive work culture.



****To Apply:



Complete the following questionnaire: 
/to/tZyKGM5o

Reply via online jobs with a 1-2 minute video covering your customer service experience and provide the best number to reach you via whatsapp.



*Applicants must have a minimum of 1 year customer service experience. Applications that do not meet this requirement will not be considered. Please ensure you follow the application instructions carefully.

title: Graphic Designer (Nightclub & Events) – Part-Time Virtual Assistant
description:

? Clear nightlife portfolio warning added at the bottom



? Clean, professional tone maintained



Graphic Designer (Nightclub & Events) – Part-Time Virtual Assistant

About the Role



We are looking for a part-time Graphic Designer Virtual Assistant to support the creative output of a busy nightclub and events brand in Australia.



This role is design-first and social-first.



Your primary responsibility is creating bold, high-impact visuals for:



Social media image ads (Meta, Instagram, TikTok formats)



Organic social media posts



Event posters and digital flyers



DJ announcements and weekly event promotions



If you do not have nightclub, DJ, party, bar, or live event design experience, this role is not a good fit.



This Role Is Social & Design Focused (Important)



This is not a general VA role.

This is not a strategy role.

This is not corporate design work.



The priority is:



Scroll-stopping social media image ads



High-energy Instagram and
 posts



Nightclub event posters



DJ lineup announcements



Story graphics and countdown creatives



You must understand nightlife culture, bold typography, lighting effects, dark themes, and attention-grabbing layouts.



Key Responsibilities

Primary Responsibilities (Core Focus)



Designing high-converting social media image ads (all dimensions)



Creating engaging organic social media posts



Designing nightclub event posters and digital flyers



Creating DJ lineup announcements and weekly promotional creatives



Adapting one concept into multiple formats (Feed, Story, Square, Vertical)



Maintaining consistent branding across weekly events



Preparing creatives optimised for paid ads and organic reach



Delivering event creatives within 12–24 hours when required



Secondary Responsibilities (Support Tasks)



Organising design files in Google Drive



Following creative briefs from the marketing team



Preparing exports correctly for each platform



Meeting weekly campaign deadlines



(No paid ads management. No marketing strategy required.)



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)



To be considered, you must have:



Experience designing for nightclubs, DJs, festivals, bars, or live events



A strong portfolio of nightlife posters and social media graphics



Experience designing both paid image ads and organic social posts



Strong typography and layout skills



Ability to create bold, energetic, modern visuals



Experience using Photoshop, Illustrator, Canva, or similar tools



If your experience is mainly corporate, real estate, ecommerce product ads, or minimalist branding — this role is not suitable.



We are specifically looking for someone who understands nightlife energy and culture.



Design Style We’re Looking For



Dark backgrounds



Neon accents



Strong lighting effects



Bold fonts



High contrast



Visually loud and scroll-stopping



Energy and movement in static graphics



What Success Looks Like in This Role



You can turn a brief into polished designs quickly



You require minimal creative direction



You consistently meet deadlines



You can handle 12–24 hour turnaround requests when events are time-sensitive



You produce high-quality work without excessive revisions



Tools You’ll Use

Canva (for resizing and variations)



Google Drive



ClickUp (task management)



Working Hours & Compensation



Part-time role (20–30 hours per week initially)



Must work during Australian business hours (full overlap required)



Must be responsive during agreed working hours



Ability to handle urgent requests when required



Long-term opportunity with potential to move to full-time



Compensation:

Please include your expected hourly rate in AUD in your application.



This role is not suitable for freelancers juggling multiple clients. We are looking for someone committed and available during working hours.



How to Apply (Important – Read Carefully)



To apply, you must include:



A short introduction about yourself



Links to nightclub, party, DJ, or event designs you’ve created



Examples of social media image ads and social posts



The tools you used



Your internet speed and equipment setup



Your expected hourly rate in AUD



Applications without relevant nightlife/event samples will not be considered.

Important:

title: Sales & Estimator Specialist
description:
About the Role



This role combines:

-Sales support

-Structured follow-ups

-Estimation coordination

-Pipeline tracking



You’ll help ensure that:



i. New leads are captured and organized

ii. Quotes move smoothly through review

iii. Clients receive timely follow-ups

iv. Opportunities don’t get “stuck”



You’ll work closely with the Estimator and leadership team to keep deals progressing in a steady, professional way.



What You’ll Be Doing

1. Lead Support & Qualification

-Log new project inquiries and tenders

-Update and maintain the sales tracking sheet

-Research decision-makers when needed

-Gather required scope details before estimation

-Ensure documentation is complete and organized



2. Structured Follow-Ups (FRE: Follow-up, Reconnect, Expand)

*Follow-up

-Confirm quote receipt via

-Conduct polite follow-up calls

-Help coordinate meetings or site visits

-Follow up after meetings to move to the next step



*Reconnect

-Re-engage dormant or previously quoted leads

-Maintain relationships with repeat builders and contractors



*Expand

-Identify additional scope opportunities

-Support cross-selling where appropriate



All activities are tracked — we value consistent, professional follow-up.



3. Estimator Coordination

You’ll support the Estimator by:

-Requesting missing project details

-Organizing documentation before pricing

-Tracking quote status (Draft ? Review ? Sent ? Follow-up)

-Managing revisions and clarifications

-Helping ensure smooth and timely quote submission



This allows the Estimator to focus on pricing while you manage communication and coordination.



4. Pipeline Tracking & Reporting

-Keep the sales pipeline accurate and updated

-Monitor aging quotes

-Provide simple weekly updates

-Flag stalled opportunities



What We’re Looking For

-Sales Development or B2B Lead Generation

-Business Development Support

-Sales Coordination or Project Sales



Skills:

-Comfortable making follow-up calls

-Organized and detail-oriented

-Confident using Google Sheets

-Familiar with CRM or tracking systems



Bonus If You Have:

-Experience in construction, trades, or project-based sales

-Experience supporting Estimators or technical teams

Who You Are:

You are:

-Proactive (you follow up without reminders)

-Confident speaking with clients

-Process-oriented

What We Offer:

How to Apply:

 your updated resume

v. Include your expected hourly rate



We review applications carefully, so please follow the instructions above.

title: Legal AI Sales & Client Success VA (Operations & Administration)
description:
This role is a virtual assistant position with a sales and client success focus for AI Legal Assistant. You are responsible for the administrative coordination that keeps our sales and client success workflows running smoothly—scheduling, sales operations, free trial stage coordination, CRM discipline, and new-client administration.



Your accountability is operational: ensuring all steps are completed, documented, and actioned with precision—so every lead and client feels the experience is organised, professional, and well managed.



Two defining expectations of this role are:

Proactivity and Accountability (you anticipate next steps and remove blockers before they appear)



Exceptional communication (excellent phone manner and outstanding written English)



Key responsibilities

1) Sales administration and scheduling coordination

Book and coordinate meetings across multiple stakeholders; manage invites, joining details, agenda notes, and required attendees.



Maintain diary integrity for the COO and relevant stakeholders: avoid conflicts/double bookings, manage time zones, and keep scheduling clean and efficient.



Run appointment confirmation and reminder workflows via phone/SMS/email (as required) to reduce no-shows and protect 
ntum.



Manage rescheduling quickly and professionally, ensuring sessions are rebooked and not lost.



2) Free trial administration and stage coordination (process discipline)

Coordinate free trials across defined stages, ensuring all administrative steps are completed accurately and on time.



Track trial readiness and required inputs (e.g., stakeholder lists, checklists, session bookings, attendance confirmations, required information captured).



Ensure every trial has a clear status, owner, next action, and date—no ambiguity and no stalled trials due to admin gaps.



Escalate risks early when a trial is likely to stall (missing info, delayed scheduling, incomplete steps).



3) New-client administration (handover hygiene)

Coordinate the admin steps that occur when a client converts: client record completeness, stakeholder mapping, key dates, internal handover notes, and task creation.



Ensure documentation is consistent and complete so the team can execute without operational friction.



Track completion of required internal admin tasks and close gaps quickly.



4) Basic client and lead enquiries follow-up (non-technical)

Follow up and respond to basic enquiries from clients and leads (scheduling, process steps, “what happens next”, standard access instructions where defined).



Route product, security, pricing, legal, or complex questions to the appropriate owner and ensure the loop is closed with the client.



5) Team task accountability and blocker removal (internal coordination)

Track key tasks across sales admin, trial admin, and new-client admin to ensure owners complete them on time.



Proactively chase outstanding actions, confirm completion, and escalate blockers before timelines slip.



Maintain clear internal visibility: what’s done, what’s pending, what’s blocked, who owns it, and the deadline.



6) CRM & schedule management (ClickUp)

Record all interactions, updates, and booking outcomes within ClickUp with high accuracy and consistency.



Tag and organise leads/clients to maintain pipeline visibility and prioritisation.



Maintain CRM hygiene: accurate statuses, contact details, stakeholder roles, trial stages, next actions, and follow-up dates.



Ensure ClickUp is reliable enough to run day-to-day operations without “backchannel” updates.



7) Reporting & feedback

Provide regular updates on admin activity, lead status, appointment conversion/show rates, trial stage progression (admin completion), and outcomes captured.



Ensure company protocols regarding the recording of important metrics are followed diligently.



Share recurring questions, objections, and process bottlenecks observed to support continuous improvement.



8) Proactivity and communication excellence (explicit expectations)

Anticipate next steps and prepare them in advance (draft confirmations, pre-create tasks, prompt stakeholders early, keep records current).



Maintain an exceptionally high standard of phone and written communication: calm, concise, polished, and appropriate for senior legal stakeholders.



Maintain templates, checklists, and workflows that improve consistency, speed, and quality.



What success looks like

Leads, team and clients consistently feel the process is organised, responsive, and professionally managed.



No blockers caused by missing admin steps, unclear ownership, or poor follow-through.



High show rates due to strong confirmation/reminder discipline.



Trials and new-client admin progress smoothly with accurate stage tracking and clean handovers.



ClickUp/CRM is current and trusted: every record has a status, history, and next action.



Required skills and capabilities

Exceptional diary management and multi-stakeholder scheduling capability.



Excellent phone manner and highly professional presence.



Outstanding written English: clear, accurate, client-ready communication.



High attention to detail, speed, and comfort operating from checklists and workflows.



CRM experience is essential (ClickUp preferred; equivalent accepted).



High accountability and self-direction: you close loops and keep 
ntum without being chased.



Must be able to work Sydney business hours (Sydney timezone) reliably.



Preferred experience

Experience in the legal industry 

Experience in sales appointment setting or managing 

Familiarity with B2B SaaS sales operations, onboarding coordination, or client success operations.



Working requirements

Must be able to work Sydney business hours (Sydney timezone) reliably.

High availability during business hours for calls, scheduling, and urgent rescheduling.

Professional home/remote setup suitable for client phone calls.



Attributes we will screen for hard

Extreme organisation and attention to detail.

Fast execution without sloppiness.

Clear, confident communication (written + phone).

Proactive follow-through: you eliminate silence and ambiguity for clients.

Calm under volume: you can handle busy weeks without dropping standards.

Accountability: we don’t need to follow you up because it’s already done





HOW TO APPLY:



To apply for the position, please send:

A freshly recorded face-to-camera video explaining why you want the role and why you are the ideal candidate. 

Your resume

At the end of your application, please write the word "kangaroo" so I'll know you aren't mass applying and have read this entire job post.

title: Sales Development Representative
description:
Virtual Business Development / Appointment Setter. 

Who We Are & What We Do

Atomic Projects is a Sydney-based specialist construction team—think of us as building doctors—focused on diagnosing and fixing structural and waterproofing issues before they turn into major headaches. We follow clear, step-by-step processes, use simple checklists and photos, and keep communication straightforward so there are no surprises.

Our Core Services

• Concrete Repairs: Fill cracks, replace spalled sections, and restore structural strength.

• Waterproofing: Install or renew membranes on balconies, rooftops, bathrooms, and more to keep water out.

• Brick & Façade Restoration: Carefully remove damaged bricks or mortar and rebuild to match the original look.

• Inspection Test Plans (ITPs): Provide detailed compliance documentation and quality checkpoints.

Who We Service

• Remedial Engineers: Consultants who design and specify repair solutions; we partner closely to implement their recommendations on time and to spec.

• Client-Side Project Managers: The client’s in-house or outsourced PMs who oversee coordination, quality control, budgeting, scheduling, and stakeholder reporting. We slot in as your go-to remedial specialists—providing clear scopes, regular updates, full compliance documentation, and fast issue resolution—so you can keep the bigger picture on track.

• Commercial Landlords & Asset Managers: Shopping centres, offices, and mixed-use sites requiring periodic maintenance.

• Insurance Companies & Loss Adjusters: Partners in diagnosing and fixing water damage or structural claims.

• Strata Bodies & Owners Corporations: Apartment complexes and communities

• Strata Managers & Facility Managers: Professionals overseeing maintenance budgets and schedules.



About the Role

We’re seeking a proactive, tech-savvy Virtual Business Development Manager & Appointment Setter to fuel our growth pipeline. From the comfort of your home office, you’ll identify target prospects, initiate outreach, and book qualified discovery calls with building owners, strata managers, and property developers. Your work lays the foundation for our on-the-ground BDMs to close high-value projects.



What You’ll Do

• Prospect & Research: Identify and qualify mid-market leads via LinkedIn, industry directories, and CRM data.

• Initial Outreach: Craft and send personalized
s, LinkedIn messages, and follow-up sequences.

• Appointment Setting: Schedule discovery calls and site visits for our on-site BDMs, ensuring calendar accuracy and prep materials.

• Lead Management: Log all activities in CRM (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce), update statuses, and maintain a clean, prioritized pipeline.

• Script & Template Development: Refine messaging scripts,
 templates, and call guides to improve conversion rates.

• Reporting & Analysis: Monitor outreach performance, track key metrics (response rates, booked meetings), and provide weekly reports.

• Collaboration: Sync with estimating and operations teams to understand service offerings and tailor outreach accordingly.



What You’ll Bring

Experience & Education

• 2+ years in appointment setting, inside sales, or virtual BDM roles—construction or engineering experience a bonus.

• Comfortable working remotely and managing your own schedule.

Skills & Attributes

• Communication: Outstanding written and verbal skills; able to craft compelling messages that resonate with decision-makers.

• Tech-Savvy: Proficient with CRM platforms (HubSpot, Salesforce) and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.

• Organisation: Exceptional time management; balances multiple campaigns and follow-ups without missing a beat.

• Persistence: Tenacious follow-up and a solution-oriented mindset—turn “no replies” into conversations.

• Detail-Oriented: Ensures data accuracy in CRM and calendar bookings.

• Team Player: Thrives in a collaborative, high-performance environment—even from a distance.



What We Offer

• Flexible Remote Work: Set your own hours and work from anywhere.

• Growth Path: Learn on the job with mentorship from our senior BDMs and leadership team.

• Competitive Compensation: Base salary plus performance-based bonuses for meetings booked and conversions.

• High-Performance Culture: Join a tight-knit team that values discipline, innovation, and continuous improvement.



Why Join Us?

• Be the spearhead of our growth engine—your outreach directly drives new business.

• Shape your own processes and scripts with full autonomy.

• Work alongside seasoned professionals dedicated to excellence and long-term impact.



How to Apply



1.
 your resume and a brief cover letter outlining:

o One recent appointment-setting success story (metrics welcome).

o Your approach to turning cold leads into qualified meetings.

o English Test Results which can be completed here: 
/english-test/

o Typing Test Results which can be completed here: 
/

2. Subject line: “Virtual BDM & Appointment Setter – [Your Name]”

3. Send to:

title: Estimator / Engineer with Onsite Experience
description:
Company Overview

We’re a small group of big thinkers working together like a well-oiled machine.

We much rather work with a few exceptional individuals than a lot of average people.

A little bit our company,

We’re based in Sydney NSW

We started in 2022

We specialise in Remedial Construction which is fixing and improving existing buildings that have problems or need updates.

It includes a wide range of activities to keep buildings safe, strong, and looking good.

1. Waterproofing

2. Concrete repairs

3. Masonry repairs

4. Facade restoration

Job Summary

The Estimating Virtual Assistant plays a crucial support role within our pre-construction team, ensuring efficient and organized estimation processes.

This position is instrumental in managing administrative tasks, organizing project documentation, and supporting the Estimator and Pre-Construction Manager with detailed preparation for upcoming projects.

The role demands a high level of organization, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities

• Meeting Coordination: Schedule and coordinate virtual meetings, including pre-construction meetings, bid discussions, and project debriefs, ensuring all necessary participants are informed and prepared.

• Deadline Management: Monitor and record project deadlines, providing timely reminders to the team to ensure that submissions and responses are prepared well in advance.

• Job Folder Organization: Set up and maintain digital job folders, ensuring that all project-related documents are accurately filed and easily accessible.

• Document Preparation and Control: Assist in compiling construction markups and preparing bills of quantities, ensuring accuracy and compliance with project requirements.

• Contractor Procurement and Management: Source new contractors, evaluate their qualifications, and maintain an up-to-date contractor list, facilitating effective bid processes and project execution.

• Administrative Support: Provide comprehensive administrative support to the estimating team, including, drafting correspondence, and any other tasks that contribute to the efficiency of the estimating process.

• Follow-Up and Feedback: Organize and manage the collection of feedback from clients and internal tea
mbers post-project completion to identify areas for improvement and celebrate successes.

• Communication: Act as a point of contact for internal and external queries related to estimation projects, ensuring clear and prompt communication.

• Data Management and Analysis: Organize and manage project data, including historical cost data, for easy access and analysis. This can help in making more accurate future estimates.

• Market Research: Conduct online research to stay updated on market trends, material costs, and the availability of subcontractors, which can influence project estimates and bids.

• Monthly Tender Reporting: Support the creation of tender reports related to projects, such as status, total amount of projects tendered, dollar value etc.



Skills and Qualifications

• Skills

o Technical Proficiency: Strong computer skills and proficiency in Plan Swift, MS Office, especially Excel, and familiarity with construction management software.

o Organizational Skills: Exceptional organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.

o Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring accuracy in all aspects of work.

o Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

o Proactivity and Initiative: Ability to work independently, take initiative, and proactively address potential issues before they arise.

• Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in civil engineering, Architecture, or Quantity Surveying

• Experience:

o Experience has a quantity surveyor is preferred.

o Experience in reading and understanding drawings and technical specifications.

Work Environment

• The Estimating Virtual Assistant will operate in a dynamic, fast-paced office setting within our pre-construction department.

• Collaboration with the Estimator and Pre-Construction Manager are key components of the role.

• The position may require occasional site visits and participation in project meetings.

• This position is fully remote, providing the flexibility to work from home.

• The Estimating Virtual Assistant will be part of a supportive virtual team, with regular online meetings and communication channels to stay connected and aligned with the team's goals and projects.

Employment Type, Compensation, and Benefits

• Employment Type: Full-Time

• Compensation: TBC on Candidate

• Benefits:

o Professional Development: Opportunities for professional growth including training sessions, workshops, and seminars.

Application Process To apply for the Estimator position, please follow the steps outlined below:

1. Prepare Your Application: Compile your resume, cover letter, and any relevant certifications or portfolios that showcase your experience and skills related to construction estimation.



2. Submit Your Application:
 your application materials to 
 Please include "Estimating VA Application" in the subject line to ensure proper routing.

• Resume / CV

• Qualifications

• Academic Transcript

• Past Projects with Photos – If any

• References

• English Test Results which can be completed here: 
/english-test/

• Typing Test Results which can be completed here: 
/



3. Review Process: Our recruitment team will review applications on a rolling basis. Qualified candidates will be contacted for an initial screening interview.



4. Interviews: Selected candidates will be invited to participate in one or more interviews. This may include interviews with the Pre-Construction Manager and other key tea
mbers, potentially including practical assessments or case studies relevant to the role.



5. Decision and Offer: Final candidates will be selected based on their interviews and reference checks. An offer will be extended to the chosen candidate, including a detailed overview of the compensation package and benefits.



6. Onboarding: Upon acceptance, the new Estimator will undergo a comprehensive onboarding process to become acquainted with our team, processes, and projects.



We appreciate your interest in joining our team and look forward to reviewing your application. For any inquiries regarding the application process or the position, please
 us at
