title: Sales Representative
description:
READ THE JOB DESCRIPTION CAREFULLY:

Please ensure that you thoroughly review the job description to understand the responsibilities and qualifications required for this role before applying.



To apply, please SUBMIT your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and qualifications.



Employment Type: Full-Time, Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM PST



Payroll: Php25,000 base + 5%–8% commission on closed deals



Role Overview:

We are seeking a motivated and results-driven Sales Representative who doesn’t just book appointments but actively drives sales and closes deals. The ideal candidate is an excellent communicator, confident in presenting to clients, and capable of generating revenue by addressing client needs, closing deals, and identifying upsell opportunities.



Responsibilities:

- Conduct outreach to potential clients through cold calls,
s, and other communication methods.

- Deliver engaging and persuasive presentations to clients to close deals effectively.

- Identify and create upsell opportunities during client meetings and presentations.

- Collaborate with the sales team to ensure seamless handoff of prospects, follow-ups, and conversion strategies.

- Maintain a deep understanding of our offerings and tailor presentations to meet specific client needs.

- Showcase confidence and professionalism while presenting, whether over the phone, via video call, or in written correspondence.

- Work independently, learn quickly, and adapt to evolving tasks and priorities.

- Focus on generating revenue, not just scheduling meetings, by proactively closing deals and ensuring client satisfaction.



Requirements:

- Familiarity with GoHighLevel, its features, and how it can be used in sales and marketing processes.

- Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, in English.

- Proven experience in delivering presentations, closing deals, and upselling in a sales environment.

- Comfort and confidence in presenting to clients and prospects to drive sales.

- Proficiency in conducting online research and gathering relevant information to tailor presentations effectively.

- Familiarity with AI and ChatGPT technologies for enhanced communication (preferred).

- Self-driven and able to work autonomously with minimal guidance.

- Organized and detail-oriented, ensuring accurate and organized record-keeping.

- Ability to compile and synthesize information from various sources to create comprehensive prospect profiles.

- Quick learner with the ability to grasp industry-specific knowledge.

- Prior experience with lead generation, sales support, closing deals, or upselling is a strong plus.



Application Process:

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and how you will contribute to the success of our client’s sales efforts through effective presentations, deal closures, and upselling.

title: Virtual Sales Operations Support
description:
Independent Contractor | Approximately 20 hours per week

Remote role | U.S. business hours required



Role Overview

This role supports a founder-led consulting business where priorities evolve quickly and preparation sometimes happens close to execution. Your job is to bring structure, follow-through, and accuracy behind the scenes so sales activity, executive meetings, and internal workflows stay organized and moving forward without constant oversight.

This is not a sales or closing role. It is an operational and executive support role for someone who stays steady under pressure, tracks details naturally, and takes pride in clean execution.



This Role Is NOT a Fit If

• You need stable, unchanging processes to work well

• You get frustrated when priorities shift

• You dislike last-minute requests

• You need highly detailed instructions before acting

• You want a sales or relationship-ownership role

• You are uncomfortable supporting live executive-level calls

• You are new to using AI tools and expect to learn them on the job



Key Responsibilities

Prospect Research & Meeting Preparation

• Maintain strong grammar, spelling, and clarity

• Use AI tools to speed research and summarization while verifying accuracy



Sales Pipeline & CRM Management

• Manage day-to-day pipeline activity in Nutshell CRM

• Update stages, notes, next steps, and follow-up dates

• Flag stalled opportunities or missing actions

• Keep records clean and easy to scan



Task & Workflow Coordination

• Track sales-related tasks and reminders in Monday

• Document requests and actions taken

• Ensure follow-through as priorities change



Weekly Call List Preparation

• Prepare a weekly call list based on active prospects and conversations

• Ensure each entry includes context, background, and clear next steps

• Log outcomes and create follow-up actions after calls



Monthly Executive Webinar Support (Live Participation)

• Attend monthly executive webinars live (camera off)

• Support Zoom execution, including recording and participant management

• Support LinkedIn Live when applicable

• Assist with preparation, invitations, reminders, and follow-up

• Capture engagement, questions, and follow-up needs in the CRM



Scripted Outreach Support (Limited Scope)

• Execute outreach only when directed, using provided scripts and templates



What Success Looks Like

• The pipeline stays organized without daily oversight

• Meetings and webinars feel prepared, even with short notice

• Executive calls are documented with clear follow-through

• Written work is consistently clean and professional

• AI is used to increase speed without sacrificing accuracy



Tools You Will Use

• Nutshell CRM

• Monday

• LinkedIn and LinkedIn Sales Navigator

• Google Workspace

• Zoom

• AI tools for research and documentation



Hands-on experience with LinkedIn, Sales Navigator, and AI tools is required.

$10–13/hour depending on experience and demonstrated capability.

Performance review at 90 days with compensation adjustment tied to ownership and system improvement milestones.



Application Process



To apply, complete the required application task at this link: 

Applications submitted without completing the task in full will not be reviewed.



Final candidates will be asked to complete a Kolbe A™ assessment. We use Kolbe to understand natural working styles and ensure strong alignment with the pace, structure, and ownership expectations of this role.



If selected to move forward, you will receive next steps after your application task is reviewed.



Goal to hire new teammate:  Within the next 3 weeks

title: Junior Revit Documenter

title: Creative Strategist – Meta Ads (DTC Performance)

/Instagram) + landing page / advertorial funnel

- Write short-form ad copy (primary text, headlines, descriptions) and script outlines



Creative production (AI statics)

- Generate static concepts using AI tools (Midjourney / Nano Banana / OpenAI image, etc.)

- Ensure brand consistency (palette, font style, layout discipline)

- Deliver ready-to-launch assets to the editor/designer



Collaboration

- Work daily/weekly with the video editor and designer to execute briefs fast

- Provide clear feedback based on performance and brand guidelines



Performance iteration

- Review results (thumbstop/CTR/CPC/CPA/CVR) and propose next tests

- Kill/scale creative based on data and learning, not opinions





What “good” looks like in 30 days

- You deliver a clear creative testing plan and run weekly cycles

- You ship consistent briefs and assets without hand-holding

- Creative velocity increases (more variants, better structure, faster iteration)



Requirements

- Proven performance creative experience for DTC (Meta is a must)

- Strong copy instincts (hooks, objections, offers, landing pages)

- Ability to produce AI statics (or willingness to learn fast)

- Organized: can run creative testing like a system

- Comfortable working async with clear deliverables



Nice to have

- Experience with quiz funnels + advertorial funnels

- Direct-response editing instincts (UGC pacing, pattern interrupts)

- Understanding of compliance in sensitive categories (if applicable)



Deliverables you’ll produce

- Weekly creative plan + angle library

- 10–30 static variants/week (depending on scope)

- 5–15 video briefs/week

- Landing page + advertorial + quiz copy drafts/iterations

title: Mortgage Loan Processor
description:
As a Mortgage Processor, you will play a crucial role in guiding loan files from submission through underwriting. Your responsibilities will include collecting and verifying documentation, maintaining clear and consistent communication with clients and internal teams, and ensuring each file meets all compliance requirements and lender guidelines. This position requires exceptional organizational skills, keen attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.



Key Duties and Responsibilities:

• Review and organize borrower documentation such as bank statements, ID, income docs, credit reports, etc.

• Ensure completeness and accuracy of the loan file prior to underwriting

• Communicate with borrowers, loan officers, and third-party vendors to gather missing documentation

• Submit files to lenders and follow up on conditions in a timely manner

• Maintain detailed notes in the CRM for each file

• Identify red flags or compliance issues and escalate as needed

• Stay updated with lender guidelines and loan product changes

• Work collaboratively with the processing and sales teams to meet deadlines

• Deliver white-glove service to every client by being proactive and solution-oriented



Success in This Role Looks Like:

• Fast turnaround on document collection and submission

• Clean, organized files with minimal back-and-forth from underwriters

• Consistent and professional communication

• Ability to handle multiple loan files at once with minimal supervision

• Contribution to a positive, accountable team culture



-Residential Properties

-Commercial Properties

-Non-QM loans



DON'T need but would benefit from knowing:

-Fix & Flip Loans

-New Construction

-Bridge loans



To Apply please send:



- A short video or voice message telling us why you’re the right person

- Your resume or short write-up of past experience

- List a prior job or employer that helped prepare you for this role

title: Finance Operations Lead (Standalone role) - Australian business
description:
Key Selling Points

• Join the inner circle of a unique Australian business… from your office!

• Learn from fun, hardworking & passionate coworkers in English

• Earn an above market income for your excellent contribution and grow with the business



Who we are?

We are an established Australian childcare group with five entities and A$10m turnover. Checkout this video as well as our website (
),
 (
/bilingualbyfive) and Instagram (
/bilingualbyfive) for more information. Our team has 80+ staff in Australia plus some remote support team based overseas! 



Who we’re looking for:

A reliable and autonomous Finance Operations Lead to independently manage the day-to-day finance function of the group. This is a standalone role suited to someone who takes ownership, builds structure, and works independently with less than four hours/week oversight.  



What you will do

You will effectively run the finance department operationally. This includes transactional finance tasks such as:

• Accounts payable management, bond and deposit receipts and repayment

• Payroll processing (multi-entity, approx. 80+ staff) 

• Bank & credit card reconciliations

• Intercompany charges and reconciliations

The role also includes accounting tasks such as:

• BAS & PAYGi preparation and submission.

• Monthly balance sheet reconciliations.

• Monthly P&L reviews and report to management.

• Payroll tax, superannuation preparation and submission.

• Annual tax return (prepared for external tax accountants).

• Workers compensation & insurance declaration and dividend statements.

• Ad hoc requests – you’ll receive different for initiatives to support the group.

Accounts receivable is largely automated via our billing system; this role focuses primarily on finance operations, accuracy, and reporting discipline.



Who we’re looking for:

• 7+ years experience in SME finance or bookkeeping

• Has worked as the “only finance person” somewhere (standalone role, minimal supervision)

• Has strong Xero experience

• Communicates clearly and confidently in English

• A motivated self-starter having a high level of self-discipline, accountability, great organization habits and keep moving forward without someone looking over your shoulder.

• Strong attention to detail and ability to check your own work

• Expertise in Outlook, Excel, Word, Sharepoint & Powerpoint and is able to document business processes

• Experience using Asana or equivalent task management software is preferred

• Availability and commitment to work within GMT+8 working hours. (8:30am-5:30pm Perth time)

• Someone who handles confidential and sensitive information with discretion and professionalism.

Work environment requirements

- A dedicated space for the home office that free from distractions 

- A steady and fast internet connection with the minimum speed of 50 Mbps, which the internet modem available next to the working desk for the IP phone installation

- Credit towards coworking office costs for the right candidate



Employment type:

• Full time



Remuneration

• Full time starting from A$2,000/month (?85,000/month)



The Perks:

• Working from your own home office or local coworking space!

• 32 days per year of paid leave! (covering Australian Public Holidays as well as holiday and sick absences)

• Reimbursement of internet and electricity or coworking space costs

• Company provided laptop and phone

• Up to 20% bonus every month if you make your supervisors love you

• Learn from and experience ex-accountant owner, external accountants and consultant bookkeeper



If you’re up for the challenge, suitable with the requirements that we need, we look forward to receiving your application. The more clearly you show your qualities against our job description requirements higher the chance of us requesting an interview with you.

s

title: Sales Executive (Tekla Detailing)
description:
Sales Executive (Tekla Detailing): Full-Time Permanent WFH 



Job description: 



About us



We are a specialized engineering firm, delivering high-quality miscellaneous and structural steel detailing services. With over 50 years of combined team experience, we produce drawings, 3D modelling renders, and project takeoffs—particularly for railings, stairs, canopies, balconies, and other miscellaneous steel components. Our clients include architectural, construction, and fabrication firms globally. 



Position Overview 



We are looking for a driven Tekla Steel Detailing and Sales Engineer to help expand our client base and sales revenue in the steel detailing / structural engineering market. This person will identify prospects, nurture leads, close deals, and build long-term relationships with firms that require detailing, modelling, and estimating services. The role requires strong technical understanding so as to communicate clearly about our services and differentiate our quality and attention to detail. 



Key Responsibilities 



Generate new business opportunities and leads in the construction, steel fabrication, architectural, and engineering sectors. 



Develop and maintain relationships with existing clients to generate repeat business and referrals. 



Present our capabilities (detailing, 3D rendering, takeoffs) to potential clients via online meetings. 



Work closely with the engineering team to understand project requirements, estimate costs, and prepare proposals. 



Follow up on proposals, negotiate terms, and close sales successfully. 



Maintain accurate sales pipeline data in CRM; forecast sales and report results. 



Collaborate with marketing to develop materials (case studies, portfolios, presentations) that highlight our past projects and expertise. 



Monitor market trends and competitor activities, especially related to steel detailing and detailing software such as Tekla Structures. 



Qualifications & Skills 



Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management, Business, or a related field preferred. 



Proven sales experience in construction, architecture, engineering, fabrication, or similar technical fields. 



Strong understanding of steel detailing, structural drawings, 3D modeling, or estimating. Familiarity with Tekla Structures or similar software is a plus. 



Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills. 



Ability to understand technical drawings and ask clarifying questions. 



Strong organizational skills; ability to manage multiple leads, proposals, and clients. 



Proficiency in using CRM systems, MS Office, and possibly technical drafting / model-viewing platforms. 



Self-motivated, results-driven, with the capacity to work independently and meet sales targets. 



Job Types: Full-time, Permanent 



Benefits: 



Additional leave 



Company Christmas gift 



Company events 



Paid training 



Pay raise 



Work from home 



Please reply with your resume via
, include a cover letter answering the following questions: (we will not entertain applications without these requirements).



Application Question(s): 



Are you familiar with steel detailing, structural drawings, or 3D modeling software (e.g., Tekla, AutoCAD, Revit)? 



Are you comfortable with lead generation, cold outreach, and negotiating contracts? 



Experience: 



B2B sales or business development: 3 years (Preferred) 



Work Location: Remote

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

mbers

title: Remote VoIP Sales and Account Manager (AU Timezone)
description:
Company: FibreMax (Australia)

Location: Remote (Philippines), full-time

Schedule: Mon–Fri, Australian Western Standard Time (AWST, same as PH time)



About FibreMax



FibreMax is a Perth-based telecom provider offering business phone systems (FibreMAX®fone) and NBN internet services across Australia. We’re a small, fast-moving team—big on customer care, practical solutions, and long-term relationships.



The Role



You’ll own the full sales cycle for our VoIP phone systems and support your customers long-term. This is a hands-on role combining outbound sales, solution design, onboarding coordination, and ongoing customer care. You’ll also assist with basic NBN modem/router support over the phone for our internet customers.



What You’ll Do



Prospect & Sell

Make cold calls and warm follow-ups to AU businesses (daily dial goals).

Qualify opportunities; conduct discovery to assess business requirements.

Prepare and present proposals/quotes; handle objections; close deals.

Keep CRM notes up to date; forecast pipeline and hit monthly targets.



Solution Design & Onboarding

Translate needs into VoIP solutions (extensions, call flows, IVR, queues, numbers, porting).

Coordinate implementation with in-house or local IT teams.

Arrange number porting and service activations; schedule cutovers.

Train end users (short remote sessions, quick guides, how-tos).



Customer Success & Support

Be the account manager for your customers—own the relationship.

Provide first-line support on phone system features and basic NBN setup (modem/router phone support and simple triage).

Liaise with our technical team for escalations; follow through to resolution.

From time to time, discuss billing queries and assist customers to update payment details.



Team & Process

Contribute to playbooks, scripts, FAQs, and training materials.

Suggest improvements to proposals, onboarding steps, and support workflows.



Must-Have Qualifications

Proven VoIP/PBX sales experience (B2B) with a track record of closing.

Solid understanding of SIP, DIDs, IVR, ring groups/queues, call recording, and number porting.

Experience with one or more PBX platforms (e.g., Enswitch, Yeastar) and Grandstream or similar IP phones.

Confident phone presence for cold calls to Australian businesses; excellent English (clear, neutral accent).

Strong written skills 
, proposals, step-by-step instructions).

Comfortable with Microsoft 365 apps and general tools (CRM, ticketing, Calendly/Zoom/GSuite).

Ownership mindset: proactive, organised, reliable, and calm under pressure.



Nice-to-Haves

Familiarity with Australian NBN (FTTP/HFC/FTTC/FTTN), basic modem/router setup.

Grandstream ecosystem (GRP/DP handsets, GWN routers/switches) and provisioning basics.

Helpdesk experience (Freshdesk/Zendesk/Jira) and light network troubleshooting.



KPIs (what success looks like)

Daily call activity and quality discovery notes in CRM.

Weekly qualified opportunities created and proposals sent.

Close rate and monthly new MRR targets achieved.

Onboarding timelines met; first-response time and CSAT on support interactions.

Low-churn, high-retention customer relationships.



Work Setup Requirements

Quiet workspace with minimal background noise.

Reliable computer capable of running current Microsoft applications.

Stable wired internet (recommended 50 Mbps+ down, 20 Mbps+ up) with a backup connection (LTE hotspot).

USB noise-cancelling headset.

Modern mobile phone for business calls.

(Nice to have) UPS/power backup to ride out short outages.



What We Offer

Competitive hourly rate (PHP) and performance bonuses.

Training on our products, pricing, processes, and sales playbooks.

Stable AU-timezone hours (aligned with PH time).



How to Apply (follow these steps exactly)



1. Subject line: `Remote VoIP Sales & AM – FIBREMAX PRO`

2. Short cover letter (max 200 words) describing your VoIP/PBX sales experience and biggest deal you closed.

3. 1-minute voice recording introducing yourself and summarising your PBX experience (Vocaroo/Loom link is fine).

4. Speed test screenshot (speedtest.net) taken from your work location today.

5. Top 3 PBX or VoIP tools you’ve used and your role in each (1–2 sentences per tool).

6. Optional: A short Loom video (?3 min) walking through a proposal you created (hide confidential info).



Hiring Process

Application screening ? Initial interview ? Skills task (light proposal & call-flow) ? Final interview ? Offer.

Probation: 90 days with clear goals, coaching, and feedback.



Want to stand out? Share a brief call-flow you’d propose for a 10-seat clinic (reception, billing, overflow to mobiles, after-hours message, voi
-to
, simple IVR).

title: TECHNICAL CUSTOMER SUPPORT, AUSTRALIAN TELCO AND NBN, VOIP
description:
About FibreMax

FibreMax is an Australian telecommunications provider delivering NBN internet and business VoIP phone systems. We are known for fast support, clear communication, and getting issues resolved properly.



Role summary

We are hiring a Technical Customer Support specialist with real experience in the Australian telco industry. You will support customers with NBN services, modem and router setup, fault finding, and VoIP troubleshooting. You will work closely with our technical lead and follow our internal processes for ticket updates, customer communication, and escalation.



Key responsibilities



1. Provide technical support to customers via phone,
, and tickets.

2. Troubleshoot NBN connectivity issues and guide customers through practical checks and fixes.

3. Assist with modem and router configuration, Wi Fi performance, and basic network troubleshooting.

4. Support VoIP services including extensions, call flows, call quality issues, and common PBX settings.

5. Understand and assist with number porting and the steps, documents, and checks required.

6. Diagnose VoIP call quality issues and confirm network requirements for reliable voice performance.

7. Work with upstream carriers and suppliers when escalation is required, and keep customers updated.

8. Keep accurate notes and real time status updates on every ticket, with clear next steps and outcomes.

9. Follow internal checklists and continuously improve documentation and troubleshooting guides.



Requirements



1. Relevant experience in the Australian telco industry.

2. Strong and well rounded NBN knowledge, including practical troubleshooting and common fault scenarios.

3. Hands on experience with modem and router configuration and fault finding.

4. Experience supporting VoIP systems, familiarity with call flows, number porting, and network requirements for quality VoIP calls.

5. Strong written and spoken English, professional and calm on calls, able to explain technical topics simply.

6. Quality, fast, and stable internet connection suitable for VoIP support work.

7. Reliable computer or laptop suitable for multiple web tools and ticketing systems.

8. Mobile phone with a noise reduction headset and microphone.

9. Quiet, dedicated work area with minimal background noise.



Nice to have



1. Experience with ticketing systems, CRMs, and structured escalation workflows.

2. Understanding of SIP concepts and basic networking, including latency, jitter, packet loss, QoS, and LAN versus Wi Fi impacts.

3. Experience supporting business customers, multi site setups, and mobile softphone users.



What we value

Calm under pressure, strong ownership, great attention to detail, and a customer first mindset. We care about doing things properly, not rushing and leaving problems half solved.



How to apply

Please include the following in your application.



1. A short summary of your Australian telco experience, including NBN and VoIP.

2. Examples of modem and router troubleshooting you have done.

3. The VoIP systems or PBX platforms you have supported, and what you worked on.

4. Your internet speed and reliability details, and a brief description of your work from home setup.

5. Your availability, preferred working hours, and expected monthly salary.

title: Financial Advice Associate - Implementation & Customer Support
description:
LOCATION: Remote

SALARY: AUD$1,500 - AUD $2,500pm (FTE)



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a highly skilled, Australian financial advice firm seeking an experienced, hard-working, and responsible self-starter to support our financial advice clients and enhancing our service:

- implementing financial advice (SOAs)

- assisting with client enquiries & onboarding

- personal insurance research and strategic analysis



ABOUT LIFE UNSHACKLED

LifeUnshackled is a platform built to help people reclaim the life they once dreamed of, clients and team alike. We exist because “retire comfortably” is not the goal, freedom is. We bring bold financial strategy and strong follow-through so clients can build real wealth and live life on their terms. You will be joining a growth-minded team that cares about ambition, high standards, and doing work that genuinely helps people unshackle their lives.

- Clear written communication skills and comfort working with structured templates and prompts.

- A proactive, organised approach and the ability to manage competing priorities.



KEY TRAITS

- Methodical and detail-oriented

- Self-managed with strong follow-through

- Clear communicator

- Collaborative and adaptable across tasks and personalities



WE OFFER

- Training and support from a passionate, purpose-driven team

- Opportunities for long-term growth and stability

- A remote, flexible work environment where your contribution is truly valued



APPLICATION PROCESS

- Your updated resume and LinkedIn profile link

- Names and contact details of three references (2 professional + 1 personal)



Your answers to the following case study:

**Case Study:**

A client
s the financial adviser requesting urgent updates on a their specific holdings in a certain stock which they're concerned about and are considering to sell 50% of, which we manage for them. You know the adviser is going to held up in meetings all day and won't even see the
. You also heard the adviser mention the day before that we plan to reduce our exposure to this one specific stock in our portfolios, due to recent market fluctuations and new technology risks that have arisen.

title: Admin/Social Meida Specialist
description:
We are looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented, and tech-savvy Administrative & Social Media Virtual Assistant whose primary responsibility is to manage client communication, support customer success, and help oversee day-to-day operations for Seaside Media Group. This role plays a key part in ensuring clients and potential clients feel informed, supported, and confident throughout every stage of their interaction with our brand, while also helping our internal team operate efficiently and productively.



This position is focused on client communication, Instagram outreach, customer success, and operational support. A good portion of this role involves Instagram-based work, including outreach to potential clients, messaging with both potential and current clients, and helping move conversations toward potential phone calls when appropriate. Strong communication skills are essential, as you will be handling conversations via Instagram DMs, potential phone calls, text messages, and
 on a daily basis. Your English must be very good, and you must have a reliable internet connection. You will work closely with our Quality Control (QC) Team to ensure seamless communication across the business.



A day in the life of this role will look something like this: starting the day by monitoring and managing all incoming communication through Instagram DMs, potential phone calls, text messages, and our support inbox, responding promptly and professionally to both potential and existing clients. Throughout the day, you’ll conduct Instagram outreach to potential clients, initiate conversations, answer questions, follow up with interested leads, and help transition qualified conversations into potential phone calls when needed. You’ll also provide regular project updates to active clients so they always know the status of their media and feel supported.



As situations arise, you’ll focus heavily on customer success by answering questions, assisting with requests, and resolving concerns. You’ll flag urgent or complex issues to the appropriate tea
mber and ensure proper follow-up. You’ll communicate consistently with our CEO and QC Team to keep projects moving smoothly and clients taken care of.



In addition to client-facing responsibilities, you’ll help oversee day-to-day operational activities to ensure efficiency and productivity. This includes assisting with the development and implementation of operational policies and procedures, optimizing workflows, managing and allocating resources when needed, monitoring key performance indicators, and identifying areas for improvement. When things slow down, you’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline systems and improve overall business performance.

title: Lead Generation & Strategic Partnerships Specialist (High-Ticket)
description:
Brand Overview:

Moshe Wigder 
 is a high-authority Expert Advisor with a community of 290,000+ followers and 10 million+ monthly views. His mission is simple: help people navigate the "Shvitz" of the real estate market. By providing the raw, unedited truth, Moshe empowers others to succeed in a complex industry. We are now seeking a specialist to help us identify and connect with strategic partners (Lenders, Tech, and Financial Services) who share our commitment to providing genuine value and honest navigation to our community.



The Role:

This is a high-responsibility "Hunter" position. You will not be doing general admin. You will report to the Operations Manager and be responsible for identifying decision-makers at US-based lenders, fintech companies, and service providers. Your goal is to initiate professional contact and open doors for $10,000+ strategic partnerships.



Daily Responsibilities:

-Conduct deep research into US-based companies (Lenders, CRM software, Insurance) that align with a high-trust real estate expert brand.

-Source 20 "A-Tier" leads daily with verified direct
s for Marketing Directors or VPs of Growth.

-Execute personalized outreach via
 and LinkedIn.

-Manage the business inbox and triage responses to the COO.

-Maintain the Master Lead Tracker.



Professional Requirements:

Applicants must have a native-level command of English and a track record of B2B communication. We require proficiency in LinkedIn and lead-sourcing tools. This role requires someone who understands the "Shvitz"—the relentless pursuit of quality. To ensure you have read this entire post, please ensure your application subject line begins with the word 'Shvitz' followed by your favorite real estate niche.



Application Process: 

In your cover letter, please:

-Analyze one of Moshe's recent IG videos. Identify one brand that would be a natural fit for a partnership on that specific post and explain why.

-Share a link or screenshot of a lead list you have curated previously.

-Confirm availability for 20 hours per week.



Compensation:

Base Pay: $6.00/hour.

Strategic Bonus: A flat $150.00 USD bounty for every successfully closed Strategic Partnership resulting from your lead.

title: Loquiz Game Builder / Game or Experience Designer
description:
Are you the kind of person who loves riddles, strategy games, escape rooms, or creative problem-solving? Do you get excited about turning ideas into interactive experiences? If so, we want you on our team.

We’re looking for a creative, logic-driven thinker to help build and refine games inside the Loquiz platform. No coding required — just curiosity, creativity, and a willingness to learn.

This is a flexible, remote-friendly opportunity with room to grow into a project-based role as your skills develop.



What You’ll Do

* Edit and improve existing Loquiz games

* Build logic-driven challenges, puzzles, and interactive experiences

* Test game flow and user experience

* Collaborate with our creative team to bring new adventure concepts to life

* Eventually design full games independently



What We’re Looking For

* Creative problem-solver

* Strong logical thinking skills

* Detail-oriented and organized

* Excited to learn new software (Loquiz platform)

* Enjoys building things from scratch

* Comfortable working independently

* Bonus: experience with puzzles, escape rooms, trivia, or experiential events



No coding experience required. No Loquiz experience required either — we’ll train you. 



Compensation & Structure

* Starts at $10/hour during training

* Flexible hours

* Remote position

* As you gain proficiency, compensation shifts to per-game / project-based rates

If you love the idea of blending creativity, logic, and experience design — we’d love to hear from you.

title: ???? Senior Dropshipping Customer Support Specialist (NL/BE Market)
description:
Senior Shopify Dropshipping Customer Support Strategist (NL/BE Market)



Remote | Part-Time | $5/hour Starting Rate + Performance Bonuses + Fast Growth



We are a fast-scaling e-commerce brand operating in the Netherlands/Belgium market.



Within 7 days, we scaled from €0 to €10,000 per day in revenue. Advertising is temporarily paused due to Chinese New Year. From early March, we resume aggressive scaling with high projected volume.



We are not hiring a general VA. We are hiring a high-level dropshipping operator who understands profit protection, refund control, and chargeback prevention at scale.



If you have real $100k+/month experience, this role will feel familiar.



Who This Role Is For



Apply only if you:



Have 5+ years of dropshipping customer support experience



Have worked in stores doing at least $100,000 per month



Are currently involved in one or more stores at that level



Have hands-on experience with China fulfillment and returns to Asia



Understand how refund rate and chargeback rate impact scaling



Can handle 40–80+ tickets per day during scaling periods



This is not entry-level. We are hiring someone who already understands the business model deeply.



What You Must Master



You confidently handle:



7–12 business day shipping times



Delayed tracking activation



“Product not as expected” complaints



Quality issues



Refund pressure



Chargeback threats



Escalating customers



You understand that:



Returns to Asia are rarely profitable



Default refund strategy = 20?shback + customer keeps product



Maximum without approval = 30?shback



Above 30% requires manager approval



If cashback is refused, the customer is responsible for return shipping to our Asia warehouse at their own cost and risk



The objective is always: Customer keeps product + prevent chargeback + minimize refund rate



Chargeback ratio must stay below payment processor thresholds.



We operate strategically, not emotionally.



Strategic Contribution (Mandatory)



This role requires more than ticket handling.



You are expected to actively contribute proven strategies from other $100k+/month dropshipping stores, including:



Refund reduction techniques



Chargeback prevention systems



Communication frameworks



Workflow optimizations



Sharing high-performing strategies is mandatory.



One-time bonus payments will be issued for strategies that measurably improve profitability.



We reward operators who think like owners.



Responsibilities



Handle incoming
s via Google Workspace



Respond to all
s within maximum 12 hours



Apply the 20–30?shback strategy correctly



Reduce refund rate



Prevent chargebacks



Report recurring issues



Suggest system improvements



Performance will be measured and tracked.



Experience Verification (Required)



Your application must include:



Stores you worked for (revenue range required)



Your exact responsibilities



Average number of tickets handled per day



The refund policy used in that store



Your personal KPIs



Your average refund rate



Your strategy for preventing chargebacks



You must be willing to verify your experience via short video call or recorded explanation.



If you cannot prove real $100k+/month involvement, please do not apply.



Compensation and Growth



Starting rate: $5/hour



7-day paid trial period



Hourly rate increase after proven performance



Ongoing performance bonuses based on refund rate reduction, chargeback reduction, profit protection, and efficiency under volume



This role grows with results.



This Role Is Not For You If



You rely on copy-paste empathy responses



You always give full refunds to avoid bad reviews



You are afraid of escalation



You cannot protect margins under pressure



You do not understand how scaling affects payment processor risk



We are looking for strategic operators, not emotional responders.



Application Process



To apply for this position:



1. Start your application with the word SCALING

2. Include all required experience details listed above

3. Send your full application directly to: 

4. At the top of your application, clearly include your preferred contact method (WhatsApp,
, etc.) for interview scheduling



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be reviewed.



We are building a serious scaling operation. If you are an experienced dropshipping support operator who understands profit protection at scale, we look forward to reviewing your application.

title: Business development manager
description:
Business Development Manager – Managed AI services



About the Role

We’re building a managed AI agent service that helps businesses reduce repetitive admin and run more smoothly.

This role is about selling operational clarity, not software licences or hype. You’ll speak to business owners and managers, understand how their work actually flows, and help them decide whether managed AI agents would remove friction.

This is consultative selling, not high-pressure closing.

What You’ll Be Doing

Reaching out to UK-based businesses (primarily via LinkedIn and
)

Booking and running short discovery calls

Using a simple assessment to identify operational pain points

Explaining our managed AI agent service in plain English

Qualifying opportunities honestly (saying “no” when it’s not a fit)

Closing clients into a clear setup + monthly retainer model

Maintaining relationships and spotting opportunities for add-ons

You’ll sell outcomes (less admin, fewer interruptions), not technical features.

Who You’re Talking To

Owners and directors of small to mid-sized businesses

Professional services, agencies, property, admin-heavy services

Typically 5–30 staff, growing, busy, slightly chaotic

These buyers value trust and clarity over clever sales talk.

What We’re Looking For

You don’t need deep AI knowledge. You do need strong business sense.

You’re likely a good fit if you:

Are comfortable speaking with business owners

Ask good questions and listen properly

Can explain complex ideas simply

Are calm, professional, and organised

Prefer consultative selling to aggressive tactics

Experience

B2B sales experience (services or solutions preferred)

Comfortable with LinkedIn outreach and video/phone calls

Experience selling retainers or managed services is a big plus

What This Role Is Not

Not cold-calling all day

Not transactional SaaS selling

Not “AI evangelism”

Not commission-at-all-costs culture

How We Sell

Short operational assessment first

Clear scope and pricing

Full setup fee upfront

Monthly managed service thereafter

Long-term relationships, not quick churn

Compensation

Base + commission (open to structure)

Commission on setup and ongoing retainer

Remote-friendly

How to Apply

Send:

A short note on why this role suits you

Brief background in B2B sales

One-Line Summary (For Job Boards)

Help businesses remove operational friction using calm, managed AI services.

title: Framer Website Designer (Front-End) – New Builds + Ongoing Updates
description:
What This Role Is

We build and maintain Framer websites for small businesses. Some projects are new builds, others are updates to existing Framer sites. We need a Framer-experienced front-end designer who can deliver clean, modern work without breaking layouts.



What You’ll Do



* Build new marketing pages in Framer when needed

* Make updates to existing Framer websites (design tweaks, new sections, fixes)

* Create and manage reusable components / variants

* Ensure clean responsive layouts across desktop/tablet/mobile

* Add/adjust sections (hero, services, FAQs, CTAs, testimonials, contact, etc.)

* Update copy, images, buttons, links, navigation, and page flow

* Set up or edit Framer CMS/Collections when needed (blog, services, locations)

* Keep projects organized (naming, structure, consistency)

* Provide a short Loom walkthrough for larger updates



Must Have 



* 3+ live Framer websites you personally built or worked on

* Strong responsive design skills (no broken mobile layouts)

* Excellent typography and spacing (clean, modern, consistent)

* Experience both building and editing (maintenance work matters here)



Nice to Have



* Basic conversion knowledge (CTA placement, section order, clarity)

* SEO structure basics (headings, internal linking, clean layout structure)

* Subtle motion/animation skills (tasteful, not distracting)



How To Apply (Required Answers)



1. Share 3–5 live Framer links you built or edited

2. For each link, say what you personally did (new build, responsiveness fixes, new sections, component system, CMS edits, etc.)

3. What’s your process for making changes to an existing Framer site without breaking it?

4. Have you used components/variants? Give a real example

5. Have you used Collections/CMS? Example (if yes)

6. Confirm you can complete a paid test task (small Framer build + edit scenario)

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Full Stack Developer to design, build, and maintain a robust, custom-built reservation and management system tailored for the unique needs of airport transportation and limousine companies.



This is a remote contract role focused on delivering a high-quality, scalable, and user-friendly platform from the ground up.



---



Compensation & Terms



* Monthly Rate: 55,360 PHP

* Payment Schedule: Paid bi-weekly.

* Contract Type: Initial 6-month contract with potential for extension based on performance and project milestones.



---



Project Goal: The Reservation System



The successful candidate will be responsible for creating a complete, end-to-end web application that includes:



1. Customer-Facing Booking Portal: A fast, responsive, and intuitive website/portal for clients to get quotes, book reservations, and manage their trips.



2. Admin/Dispatch Dashboard: A comprehensive back-end system for managing reservations, tracking payments, generating reports, and assigning trips.



3. Chauffeur Mobile Interface (API/Web App): A simplified interface or robust API endpoint for drivers to view assigned trips, update status (en route, on location, dropped off), and log hours/mileage.



4. Payment Gateway Integration: Secure integration with a major payment processor (e.g., Stripe, PayPal, etc.).



5. Mapping/GPS Integration: Integration with mapping services (e.g., Google Maps) for route calculation, real-time vehicle tracking display, and geo-fencing features.



---



Key Responsibilities



* Architect and implement the entire system, from the database schema to the front-end user interfaces.

* Write clean, well-documented, and performant code that is easy to maintain and scale.

* Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and translate business logic into technical specifications.

* Manage deployment, testing, and troubleshooting across development, staging, and production environments.

* Ensure the system is secure, especially regarding payment processing and client data.



---



Qualifications



* Minimum 2-3 years of experience as a Full Stack Developer.

* Proven ability to complete an entire web application development lifecycle independently.

* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

* Ability to work autonomously in a remote environment.

* Prior experience building logistics, booking, or e-commerce platforms is a massive advantage.



---



To apply, please submit your resume, a link to your portfolio/GitHub profile, and briefly describe your experience with developing real-time scheduling or reservation features in a previous role.

?

title: Legal Document Editor (New Zealand - Full Time)
description:
A bit about us:

I run 
. We help New Zealanders who have lost their driver’s licences get back on the road legally so they can keep their jobs and support their families.



Losing a licence in NZ is a massive crisis for most people. We provide the "pathway out" by preparing their Limited Licence applications. 



Our new clients fill out an online form and then their data is automatically merged into our precedents. A detail orientated person then needs to revise the documents to turn the information that our clients have provided into polished and formatted court ready documents.



The Role:

I am looking for a sharp, detail-obsessed Law Graduate (Juris Doctor) or a high-level Legal VA to join the team as a Legal Document Editor.



Your job is to take the drafts our system generates and give them a rigorous "human polish." You’ll be ensuring that the Affidavits sound authentic, the Draft Orders are legally precise, and every single detail is accurate and correct.



I presently have two staff based in New Zealand who handle the whole process. We are wanting to have someone dedicated to  the initial document so that we can focus on client management and the other elements in the application process/



This role will begin solely in document drafting but there is room for the role to grow into handling other aspects of the business.



What you’ll be doing:



Document Editing: Taking the raw data a client puts into our form and smoothing it out so it reads as a professional, sworn statement for a Judge.



The "Logic Check": If a client says they work in Auckland but their driving route says Christchurch, you need to catch that. You are the filter that prevents embarrassing errors in court.



Further Information: Our clients frequently give us incomplete and poor answers. We need you to pick up on what further information would be required to complete the document.



Police/Court Readiness: Making sure the final PDF is formatted exactly how a Registrar or Police Prosecutor expects to see it.



Who you are:



A Law Degree is a massive plus. If you've spent years reading and drafting motions or orders, you’ll find this work straightforward but rewarding.



You are a "Detail Hawk." You’re the type of person who gets annoyed by a misplaced comma or a inconsistent font.



You understand "High Stakes." You know that if we get a driving hour wrong (e.g., 7am instead of 7pm), our client could end up in legal trouble. You take that responsibility seriously.



Native-level English. Your writing should be indistinguishable from a New Zealand legal professional.



The Setup:



Pay: Pay is dependent on qualifications and experience. If you are a JD who is over-qualified for "general VA" work, this may be a good role for you.



How to Apply (The Attention Test):

I get a lot of applications, so I only respond to those who follow these steps:



Subject line: "Limited Licence Specialist - [your name]



Attach a CV and an example document that you have drafted.



I’m looking for a long-term partner who wants to help me scale this business as we grow.

title: Experienced Property Management Specialist (OwnerRez & Remote Operations Expert)
description:
Are you a Property Management Rockstar who is fast, efficient, and tech-savvy?



We are an established, San Francisco Bay Area-based property management firm with nearly 8 years of success in the short-term (STR) and long-term rental (LTR) industry. We have built a reputation for excellence, and we are looking for a seasoned professional to join our stable, high-performing team.



We don’t just need "customer service"—we need a Property Management Expert who understands the mechanics of the industry, moves quickly, and never lets a detail slip through the cracks.



Why Join Us?

Proven Stability: Work for a company with an 8-year track record of growth and industry expertise.

High-Speed Environment: We value efficiency. If you are fast and productive, you will thrive here.

Professional Standards: We have clear processes in place—no "startup" guesswork.

100% Remote: Long-term, stable remote work from your home office.



The Requirements (Strict)

Please do not apply if you only have general Call Center/BPO experience. We require specific industry expertise.

Direct Property Management Experience: Minimum 2+ years managing Short-Term Rentals (Airbnb/VRBO) and Long-Term Rentals.

PMS Mastery: Advanced proficiency in OwnerRez is highly preferred. You should know how to navigate workflows, triggers, and guest communication within the platform.

Operational Speed: You must be fast-thinking, fast-typing (60+ WPM), and able to handle multiple guest issues simultaneously without losing quality.

Reliability: We require high accountability. As an established firm, we rely on teammates who respect schedules and deadlines.

Tech Stack: Knowledge of AI tools (ChatGPT), Time Doctor, and dual-monitor setups.



Your Responsibilities

End-to-End Guest Management: Manage inquiries, bookings, and high-stakes resolution cases across Airbnb, VRBO, and direct sites.

Property Oversight: Coordinate check-ins/outs, send and track lease agreements, and monitor security footage.

Logistics & Maintenance: Schedule cleaning teams, review quality assurance photos, and manage supply inventory.

Listing Optimization: Maintain and optimize listings to ensure maximum occupancy and 5-star reviews.

Process Contribution: Use your experience to help refine our established internal workflows.



Compensation & Benefits

Base Pay: Starting at $5/hour (Negotiable for candidates with extensive Property Management experience).

Schedule: Pacific Standard Time (PST) | Includes Weekends

Paid Leave: Accrued leave credits after 1 year

Bonus: Performance-based bonuses



How to Apply

To filter for the high-attention-to-detail candidates we need, please follow these steps exactly:

 your Resume to 
 Introduction: Record a brief intro highlighting your specific experience with PMS and STR/LTR management. (Share via Dropbox/Google Drive link).

Subject Line: Must be: [Property Management Specialist] – (Last Name, First Name)

Expertise Check: In your
, briefly describe the most complex issue you resolved in OwnerRez or a similar PMS.



Bonus: End your
 by telling us who the current Prime Minister of the United Kingdom is.

title: VFX / Velocity Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video
description:
VFX / Velocity Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video



**Brand:** Prismiera (Luxury Jewelry)

**Pay:** $1100 USD/month

**Type:** Full-time, 40 hours/week

**Location:** Remote (Philippines)

**Software:** Premiere Pro + After Effects (mandatory)



---



## The Mission



Prismiera is a pre-launch luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series - 35–50 second stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and other on-brand topics posted across TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



The aesthetic is **History and mythology meets high fashion**. The editing energy is closer to a perfectly-timed **After Effects edit** than a corporate product video. Every cut serves the story.



You will receive a script, a voiceover file, and a mood reference. Your job is to **build the scene from nothing**: generate AI visuals, voiceovers, source archival footage, layer sound design, and deliver a short where every second earns the next. A visual storyteller.



---



## The Style



**YES:** Dark luxury. Museum. AE VFX edit. Stylish/Lethal. Rich textures. Clean typography. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention.



**NO:** CapCut default presets. Anything that looks like a stock photo slideshow or a corporate deck.



You understand that more effects does not necessarily mean better. Every cut has a reason.



---



## Core Skills (Non-Negotiables)



**Motion Graphics** You can build scenes, transitions, and visual elements from scratch in After Effects - not just cut footage.



**Voiceover-First Storytelling.** You are editing to a *narration* primarily, music track second. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate. You never bury the script's punchline under a flashy transition. The voice leads - the visuals serve.



**Retention Instinct.** You understand that the first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually, not just with text overlays. Every 2–3 seconds, something changes.



**Rhythm & Beat-Sync.** You can sync cuts, zooms, and effects to music. You understand "the drop." If you've made AMVs, fan/anime edits, or phonk edits, you already have this skill - we want you to apply it with restraint.



**AI-Assisted Asset Creation.** You are comfortable generating images and short clips using tools like Midjourney or Kling. (We usually move onto new tools as soon as they are released). You treat AI as a production tool, not a novelty. We provide all paid accounts - you bring the creative judgment.



---



## Bonus Skills (Not Required, But We'll Notice)



- After Effects compositing - Mocha tracking, light matching (future projects will involve product placement in video scenes)

- Typography sense - fonts that feel intentional, never default

- Color grading - pushing AI output and footage into a consistent palette

- Sound design beyond music - layering SFX on movement, crafting risers and hits



---



## Weekly Output



**Ramp-up (first 2–3 weeks):** 2–3 shorts as you learn the brand voice and pipeline.

**Steady state:** 4–5 shorts per week at the locked quality standard.



You will work from clear creative briefs with reference scripts, mood boards, and audio clips for most batches.



---



## How to Apply



**Do not send a generic cover letter.**



**Subject line:** Lethal Editor - [Your name]



Use 7 apply points or more when applying.



**Send the following (in this order):**



1. **The Story Test.** Link to ONE short-form video you edited that includes **voiceover or spoken dialogue**. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script.



2. **The AE Style Test.** Link to ONE video that shows your **visual rhythm and editing craft** - an AMV, fan edit, fashion reel, or anything where the editing itself is the skill. It doesn't need to be "dark" or "luxury." It needs to show us how you think about pacing and impact.



3. **AI Experience (1 sentence).** What is your experience level with generative AI tools (Midjourney, seedream, Kling, etc.)? If none, say so - we'll evaluate the rest of your application on its own merits.



4. **Hardware.** Your PC specs: CPU / GPU / RAM. Plus your internet upload speed.



5. **Turnaround Estimate.** How long does a 30–50 second high-quality short typically take you, start to finish?



6. **The Rewrite.** Rewrite this sentence to sound dark, powerful, and modern: *"She is really cool and strong and she wins."*



---



## Paid Trial (Shortlisted Candidates)



Before any full-time commitment, we run a weekly paid trial. We provide real scripts and style references. You deliver 30–50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week (after work). If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to $550 USD payments every 2 weeks (before work).



This protects both of us - you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



---



## What We Offer



- **Paid accounts** for all frontier AI tools; seedance2.0, seedream5.0, etc.

- **Creative identity** - you're building the visual identity of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

- **Clear briefs** - most, if not every batch comes with scripts, audio files, mood boards, and specific reference videos

- **Direct feedback** - specific, constructive notes on every edit.

- **A brand worth building** - Prismiera launches April 2026. A second AI native game/anime brand after that. You're not joining a machine. You're helping build one.

title: Sales Closer
description:
How to Apply

* Send your most updated resume to 



About us:



Gushwork.ai builds AI Agents that help small and medium businesses automate their entire inbound marketing stack — from SEO and website content to reviews, blogs, and lead funnels. Our current focus is the manufacturing and industrial distributors industry.



In plain English: we’re replacing bloated marketing agencies with intelligent, always-on software.



Backed by Lightspeed, SIG, Beenext, and B Capital, Gushwork.ai is one of the fastest-growing AI companies globally.



In just a year, we’ve grown to $1.5M ARR and are scaling fast toward $15M ARR in the next 12 months — helping thousands of small businesses grow smarter, not harder.



The Role:



We’re looking for a closer who thrives in fast-paced, high-velocity sales environments. You’ll own the full sales cycle from discovery to close for qualified meetings booked by our 10-person BDR team. This is a quota-carrying role where you’ll close 4-8 deals monthly, with deal cycles ranging from 1-3 calls.



Working Hours: US Shift (9:00 AM - 6:00 PM EST)

Work Mode: Remote



What You’ll Do:



- Run discovery calls with qualified prospects (OEMs, distributors, manufacturers) to uncover pain points around lead generation and digital presence

- Deliver compelling demos that connect our AI SEO solution to specific business outcomes and revenue impact

- Navigate buying committees within SMB organizations, typically engaging with Marketing Directors, Sales Leaders, and C-suite

- Close deals on 12-month contracts with ACV of $5k-$25k, meeting or exceeding monthly quota

- Manage pipeline with discipline—forecast accurately, maintain detailed CRM hygiene, and move deals forward with urgency

- Partner with Growth Managers post-sale to ensure smooth handoffs and identify expansion opportunities

- Iterate on sales methodology by sharing wins/losses and collaborating on improving conversion rates



What Success Looks Like:



- Month 1-2: Ramp on product, market, and sales process; close your first 2-3 deals

- Month 3+: Consistently hit/exceed quota of 4-8 closed deals monthly

- Ongoing: Maintain 30%+ demo-to-close conversion rate and sub-30 day sales cycles



You’re a Great Fit If You Have:



- 2-4 years of closing experience in B2B SaaS, MarTech, or digital services

- Proven track record hitting/exceeding quota in a high-velocity sales environment

- SMB sales chops—you know how to build urgency, handle objections, and close without lengthy procurement cycles

- Consultative selling skills—you diagnose before prescribing and can articulate ROI clearly

- Comfort with ambiguity—you’re joining an early-stage startup where adaptability matters

- CRM proficiency (Zoho, HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.) and strong process discipline

- Excellent English communication skills for engaging with global prospects

- Want to hustle like crazy to hit the numbers!



Bonus Points For:



- Experience selling to manufacturers, distributors, or industrial/B2B companies

- Background in SEO, content marketing, or lead generation solutions

- Track record in 1-3 call close environments

- Familiarity with AI-powered products

- Experience selling to US/international markets



What We Offer:



- Accelerators for over-quota performance—top performers earn significantly more

- Qualified pipeline delivered daily by our BDR team—focus on closing, not prospecting

- Fast feedback loops—short sales cycles mean you learn and earn quickly

- Career growth—as we scale, top performers move into senior AE or team lead roles

- Equity in a VC-backed rocketship

- Collaborative, high-performance culture where wins are celebrated and losses are learning 
nts

- Remote work



Our Sales Process



- BDR books qualified meeting ? hands off to you

- Call 1: Discovery (30-45 min) - understand business, pain points, buying process

- Call 2: Demo + Proposal (45-60 min) - tailored walkthrough, ROI discussion, pricing

- Call 3 (if needed): Negotiation/Close - handle final objections, terms, signatures

- Handoff to Growth Manager for onboarding



How to Apply

* Send your most updated resume to

title: Senior Amazon Wholesale Product Research Specialist (U.S. Drop Shipping Experts Only)
description:
We are a growing U.S.-based Amazon wholesale drop shipping operation seeking a high-level, experienced Amazon Wholesale Product Research Specialist.

This is NOT a beginner role.

This is NOT retail arbitrage.

This is NOT online arbitrage.

We are only interested in professionals who have proven experience sourcing profitable products from legitimate U.S. wholesalers and distributors who drop ship under the seller’s name.

If you do not have direct experience working with U.S.-based wholesale suppliers that offer drop shipping, please do not apply.

What You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying profitable products from U.S. wholesale supplier catalogs

Researching and verifying legitimate wholesale distributors

Analyzing supplier price lists against Amazon listings

Calculating ROI, margins, fees, and break-even points accurately

Evaluating competition, Buy Box rotation, sales rank, and pricing stability

Managing and adjusting pricing using repricing software

Monitoring account health risks related to wholesale drop shipping

Ensuring all sourcing aligns with Amazon policies

Required Qualifications (Non-Negotiable)

Proven experience in Amazon wholesale drop shipping (U.S. market)

Existing knowledge of legitimate U.S. wholesale distributors

Strong expertise in Amazon Seller Central

Advanced experience using tools such as:

Keepa

SellerAmp

Tactical Arbitrage

Repricing software

Deep understanding of:

Buy Box mechanics

Sales rank analysis

Brand restrictions

Amazon compliance and policy risks

Ability to work independently and think strategically

What We’re Looking For

We want someone who:

Thinks like a business owner, not just a VA

Prioritizes long-term account safety

Understands risk management in wholesale drop shipping

Has strong analytical skills and attention to detail

Can deliver consistent, scalable results

This role is for a serious professional who understands the wholesale ecosystem in the United States.

We offer a starting fixed salary of $600 per month (full-time).

This is a performance-based growth position. Salary increases and bonuses will be based strictly on:

Quality of product research

Accuracy of ROI and profit calculations

Number of profitable products approved

Overall contribution to business growth

Consistency, reliability, and attention to detail

High performers can earn raises and performance bonuses, with total monthly compensation reaching up to $1,000+ per month, depending entirely on results.

We reward quality, not volume. If you consistently bring profitable, sustainable wholesale products and help grow the account safely, your compensation will grow with it.

This is a long-term opportunity for someone serious about building and scaling a U.S. Amazon wholesale operation

How to Apply

To confirm you have read and understood this entire job description, begin your application with the following sentence:

“I AM AN EXPERIENCED U.S. AMAZON WHOLESALE DROP SHIPPING SPECIALIST.”

Then briefly list:

The U.S. wholesalers/distributors you have worked with

The tools you use daily

Your average ROI target

Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered

title: n8n Expert Needed — AI Product Infographic Pipeline (Last Mile) (Nano Banana)
description:
## What We Have



A working n8n workflow (36 nodes) that generates 6 product infographic images per product for Amazon using Gemini AI. Pipeline: Shopify webhook ? product analysis ? strategy ? prompt generation ? image editing ? Google Drive upload.



Output quality is at ~85%. Prompts, brand system, and image strategy are done.



## The Problem



AI-generated text on images is inconsistent:

- Font weight/size varies between images

- Occasional spelling errors

- Hero image sometimes misinterprets the brief



We need 100% production-ready output with zero manual intervention across 3,000+ products.



## What We Need



Someone to architect and build the solution that gets us from 85% to 100%. Options we've considered:

- QC retry loop (Gemini Vision checks output, retries on failure)

- Programmatic text overlay (AI generates scenes without text, code node adds real fonts after)

- Something else entirely — we're open to better ideas



## Requirements



- Strong n8n experience (complex workflows, not basic flows)

- Image processing skills = Nano Banana

- Familiar with Gemini API or similar AI image models

- We'll share the full workflow JSON



## To Apply



Tell us: what's your approach to solve this, rough hours estimate, and when you can start.

title: Real Estate Market & Licensing Research Specialist
description:
Company Overview:

We are a service based company seeking a highly analytical and detail oriented Real Estate Market & Licensing Research Specialist to support our investment and development initiatives. This role is ideal for someone passionate about real estate, market analysis, and helping identify profitable opportunities for investment and growth.



Position Overview:

This position focuses on conducting thorough research on real estate markets, property rehabilitation opportunities, and state-specific licensing requirements for certain programs. The ideal candidate is highly detail-oriented, great with numbers, experienced with the BRRRR Method (Buy, Rehab, Rent, Refinance, Repeat), understands basic construction pricing and workflow processes, evaluates auction properties, demonstrates out-of-the-box thinking, and is capable of performing in-depth research on programs such as Article 28 and Article 31, compiling step-by-step guides for licensing and approvals. The role requires strong follow-through to ensure all aspects of a project are completed from research to execution



Key Responsibilities:



Conduct detailed real estate market research to identify the best-performing and emerging markets for investment



Provide comprehensive market analysis reports, including metrics such as average home prices, rental rates, property values, and local market trends



Research rehab (renovation) opportunities in targeted markets and estimate potential costs, returns, and project feasibility



Understand basic construction pricing, set up, and workflow processes to better evaluate rehab projects



Evaluate auction properties, identifying promising deals and assessing potential risks and returns



Prepare clear and organized Excel reports summarizing findings, including property data, rehab budgets, auction analysis, and deal breakdowns for management review



Perform state-by-state research on rules and procedures for obtaining licenses or approvals required to run certain programs (e.g., Article 28, Article 31, etc.)



Compile step-by-step guides detailing how to file and obtain necessary licenses or program approvals in each state



Present research findings and recommendations in a clear and concise format, using innovative approaches to problem-solving



 Follow through on all aspects of projects from initial research to final execution, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and actionable outcomes  

On-site engagement  from A-Z



Requirements:



Experience in real estate research, data analysis, or investment support



Strong understanding of market evaluation, property trends, and basic rehab cost analysis



Knowledge of basic construction pricing and workflow processes



Experience evaluating real estate auctions and identifying profitable opportunities



Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (formulas, data organization, and presentation)



Proven ability to conduct independent, detailed research and summarize findings effectively



Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Strategic, detail-oriented, and solution-focused mindset



Demonstrated out-of-the-box thinking to find creative solutions and uncover unique opportunities



Great with numbers and experienced with the BRRRR Method



Fluent in American English (spoken and written)



Position Details:



Type: Full-time



Schedule: Monday to Friday



Hours: 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM (1-hour lunch break)



Compensation: $550 USD per month (paid monthly)

title: Marketing and Creative Assistant
description:
About the Client



You’ll be supporting an Australian creator-led business in the dance/education space with a large back-catalogue of video content and an active audience across YouTube and
. The work is practical, fast-moving, and focused on getting consistent content out the door—without overcomplicating things.



Your Impact



Within 90 days, you’ll help the creator publish short-form content consistently, reduce the weekly “content bottleneck”, and build a simple, repeatable workflow that keeps 
ntum. This isn’t about perfection—it’s about reliable output, clean execution, and steady improvement.



Key Responsibilities



Repurpose existing long-form videos into YouTube Shorts using an efficient workflow (AI clip generation + selection + light editing).

Create batches of draft shorts, flag the strongest clips, and refine them so they’re clear, watchable, and on-brand.

Apply a consistent style using existing templates (captions/look & feel), with small improvements over time.

Export, upload, and schedule Shorts to the YouTube channel (titles, basic metadata, consistency).

Create/update thumbnails in Canva using provided templates (no need to design from scratch).

Track performance basics (views, retention, simple trends) and share a weekly snapshot to guide what to double down on.

Communicate daily: end-of-day update covering what you did / what didn’t work / what’s next / blockers.

As capacity allows (later stage): cross-post selected Shorts to
/Instagram and assist with simple marketing admin (e.g., basic newsletter or opt-in support using existing tools/templates).

Must-Have Qualifications (Self-Check)



2+ years editing short-form content (Shorts/Reels/TikTok) with a focus on speed + clarity

Comfortable working with Filmora (Wondershare) or willing to learn it quickly (and/or propose a faster tool that achieves the same outcome)

Confident uploading and scheduling content on YouTube

Canva skills (template-based thumbnails and simple visual assets)

Strong English comprehension (you can judge whether a clip “makes sense” and catch awkward cut points)

Proactive communicator: You raise blockers early and don’t disappear

Can work within AEST overlap and provide daily EOD updates

Reliable home setup: stable internet, headset, and a distraction-managed workspace

Nice-to-Have Skills



Experience using YouTube optimisation tools (e.g., vidIQ/keyword tools) for titles and basic SEO

Experience 
 content across
/Instagram (platform-specific formatting awareness)

Familiarity with newsletter/email platforms (Kajabi/Mailchimp/Beehiiv or similar)

A strong creative eye: you can suggest small tweaks that lift quality without adding hours

Success Outcomes (30/60/90 Days)



30 Days: You can run the full Shorts workflow end-to-end with minimal supervision; publish consistently (target range: 8–15 Shorts/week, depending on complexity), with clean captions and sensible clip selection.

60 Days: You help lock in a repeatable “house style” (templates + do/don’t examples), reduce rework, and improve titles/thumbnails consistency.

90 Days: Publishing is steady and predictable; weekly reporting is clear; turnaround time improves; the creator feels confident the content machine runs without chasing.

Job Type: Part-time

* Engagement must be genuine — no automation, bots, or spam comments.

* After the first month, the role is fully independent. Failure to consistently meet expectations will result in termination.
