title: E-Commerce Manager – Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair & Shopify and more
description:
About Us



We operate multiple product divisions with established manufacturing, strong margins, and differentiated products.



Plastair – Manufactured hose assemblies and industrial products, primarily B2B and OEM driven



DeeVa – Consumer and therapeutic products, including branded DTC and marketplace sales



PlastairFyre – Outdoor and metal products with growing ecommerce potential



These divisions already have real products, customers, and supply chains in place. What is missing is a unified, disciplined ecommerce engine that can scale profitably across marketplaces and DTC without daily owner involvement.



Role Overview



We are seeking a senior E-Commerce Manager to own and scale our ecommerce business across Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair, and Shopify. This is a management and decision-making role, not a task execution role.



You will be responsible for building and leading the ecommerce function, making commercial decisions, hiring and developing a capable team, and delivering profitable growth. You will operate with a high degree of autonomy and are expected to treat the business as if it were your own.



Core Responsibilities



Team Building and Leadership



Design the ecommerce org structure required to win across marketplaces and DTC



Hire, onboard, and manage internal tea
mbers and external specialists



Set clear roles, expectations, KPIs, and accountability for all ecommerce functions



Coach and develop the team so execution does not depend on any single person



Make hiring, performance, and replacement decisions as needed



Ecommerce Ownership and Execution



Full ownership of ecommerce revenue, profitability, and growth



Define ecommerce strategy across Amazon, Walmart, Wayfair, and Shopify



Build, hire, and manage internal staff and external partners (ads, creative, catalog, operations)



Own marketplace and DTC performance, pricing, promotions, margin, and inventory health



Establish SOPs, KPIs, and reporting for all ecommerce functions



Oversee day-to-day ecommerce operations while staying focused on strategy and outcomes



Make data-driven decisions at the SKU, category, and channel level



Reduce owner involvement by fully owning decisions and execution through your team



What This Role Is



A management and leadership role



Accountable for profit and sustainable growth



Focused on decision-making, prioritization, and accountability



A long-term role with room to grow into full ownership of the ecommerce division



What This Role Is Not



Not a consulting or advisory position



Not a task-only execution role



Not a part-time or side engagement



Required Experience



Proven experience managing ecommerce channels (Amazon required, others preferred)



Demonstrated ownership of revenue outcomes, not just tasks



Experience building and managing teams



Strong understanding of ads, listings, pricing, inventory, and fulfillment



Comfortable making decisions with imperfect information



Experience reporting on and improving metrics such as revenue growth, margin, ACOS, ROAS, conversion, and inventory turns



What We’re Looking For



Someone who is comfortable being accountable



Someone who makes decisions and stands behind them



Someone who thinks like an owner, not an assistant



Someone who values systems, structure, and execution discipline



Someone who wants to build something long-term



How to Apply



To be considered, please submit:



Your resume



Links to ecommerce brands, stores, or marketplaces you directly managed, including specific results



Optional: a short Loom video introducing yourself and one relevant case study

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
About the Role



We're looking for a Full Stack Developer to join our client’s growing engineering team and help drive innovation in their core fintech platform. This is an exciting opportunity to work on impactful, customer-facing features within a modern banking and payments environment.



You’ll be collaborating directly with the Head of Engineering, as well as cross-functional partners in Product and Design, you’ll help build and scale the integration layer and user-facing components that power seamless, reliable financial transactions. From cashback logic and Visa payment processing to reporting systems and batch jobs for debt collection, you’ll work on mission-critical features that directly impact the customer experience. Beyond backend development, you’ll also contribute to refining the financial UX and UI, ensuring customers enjoy an intuitive and effortless digital banking journey. 



If you're eager to work in a fast-paced environment and build elegant, efficient solutions for real-world financial challenges, we’d love to connect with you.



Key Responsibilities



Fintech Systems Development



Design, develop, and maintain core services within the banking and payment integrations layer.

Build and support features including cashback logic, transaction processing (e.g. Visa), and scheduled batch jobs for backend operations like reporting and debt collection.

Ensure robust, performant code and smooth deployment pipelines using modern cloud infrastructure.

Work closely with Product Managers and Designers to translate requirements into high-quality technical solutions.



Customer-Facing Feature Enhancements



Bring intuitive financial experiences to life by transforming UX/UI concepts into polished product features.

Continuously refine flows related to transaction histories, cashback programs, and user balances to enhance usability and clarity.

Contribute to improving customer engagement and satisfaction through thoughtful software development.



Team Collaboration and Growth



Share ideas and propose technical improvements to existing systems and workflows.

Participate in regular planning sessions and code reviews to support team cohesion and knowledge sharing.

Take on additional tasks as needed to support broader product or engineering goals.





Other Responsibilities



Make necessary process suggestions and improvements which can help the team.

Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. 

Perform other related tasks and duties that may be assigned by the client later on.



About You



2–3 years of experience as a Software Engineer.

Solid background in software development and system design.

Proficiency in Golang, AWS ECS, and Terraform, or equivalent programming languages and cloud infrastructure tools.

Experience working closely with Product and Design teams to bring product roadmaps to life.

Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced fintech environment.

title: Senior Front-End / Mobile Software Engineer (React Native)
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a Senior Front-End / Mobile Software Engineer (React Native) to join our client’s growing fintech engineering team and help build high-quality, customer-facing digital financial products.



In this role, you will lead the development of mobile applications that power real-world financial experiences, including transaction history views, cashback programs, account balances, and reporting dashboards. You’ll work closely with Engineering, Product, and Design teams to deliver scalable, performant, and intuitive mobile experiences that directly impact customer trust and engagement.





This is a hands-on senior role suited to experienced engineers who enjoy working in fintech, payments, or data-driven products, and who want to influence both technical direction and user experience across iOS and Android platforms.





Tech Stack



Front end: React Native (TypeScript)

Backend: Golang (API-driven services)

Cloud & DevOps: AWS, CI/CD pipelines



Key Responsibilities



Front-End Systems & Product Development



Design, build, and maintain modern mobile applications using React Native, TypeScript, and JavaScript.

Translate complex financial data and backend Golang APIs into clear, responsive, and user-friendly mobile interfaces.

Own client-side architecture decisions including component design, state management, navigation, and performance optimisation.

Ensure high standards of code quality, testing, accessibility, and maintainability across mobile platforms.



Customer-Facing Experience & UX Excellence



Collaborate closely with Product Managers and Designers to turn UX/UI designs into production-ready mobile features.

Build and enhance customer flows related to transactions, cashback rewards, balances, and financial insights.

Optimise mobile performance across iOS and Android devices, accounting for different screen sizes and device capabilities.

Advocate for best-in-class mobile UX while balancing technical and business requirements.



Technical Leadership & Collaboration



Provide technical guidance and mentorship to other engineers.

Participate in code reviews, sprint planning, and architectural discussions.

Proactively identify opportunities to improve front-end tooling, workflows, and development processes.

Take ownership of key client-application initiatives and contribute to broader engineering goals.



Other Responsibilities



Make necessary process suggestions and improvements which can help the team.

Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.

Perform other related tasks and duties that may be assigned by the client later on.



About You



5+ years of professional experience as a Front-End Engineer, Mobile Engineer, or Software Engineer.

Strong expertise in React Native, TypeScript, and JavaScript.

Proven experience building complex, data-driven mobile applications, ideally in fintech, payments, SaaS, or consumer-facing platforms.

Deep understanding of mobile application architecture, performance optimisation, accessibility, and best practices.

Experience collaborating closely with Product and Design teams in an agile environment.

Comfortable working with API-driven backends, ideally built with Golang.

Strong communication skills and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Experience with cloud platforms, CI/CD pipelines, or AWS is highly regarded.

Experience shipping and maintaining apps on the Apple App Store and Google Play Store is a plus





Finer Details



Schedule: TBD

Start Date: ASAP

title: Analytics Implementation Specialist (GA4, GTM, WordPress, CallRail)
description:
Analytics Implementation Specialist (GA4, GTM, WordPress, CallRail)

Full-Time | 35 Hours/Week | $12,480–$14,560/year | Long-Term Role



Overview

We are a U.S.-based performance marketing agency serving service businesses.



We are hiring a detail-oriented Analytics Implementation Specialist to manage:

- GA4 implementation

- Google Tag Manager (GTM) setup

- WordPress form configuration

- CallRail tracking configuration

- Conversion tracking validation

- QA testing for onboarding and website launches



If tracking breaks, revenue is lost. Your job is to make sure tracking, forms, and call routing are deployed correctly and tested before launch. This is a non-client-facing, execution-focused role. You will work inside structured checklists and validate your own work. Accuracy is the priority.



Salary & Schedule

- $12,480–$14,560 per year

- Paid on the 1st and 15th of each month

- Full-time (35 hours per week)

- Must overlap at least 6 hours with US Pacific Time

- Unlimited PTO (2-week minimum strongly encouraged)

- Long-term, stable position

- We are looking for someone who wants stability and long-term growth.



Core Responsibilities

1. GA4 & Google Tag Manager (GTM)

- Deploy GA4 tracking properly on WordPress sites

- Configure and manage Google Tag Manager containers

- Set up and validate event tracking

- Test conversion tracking across paid channels

- Confirm tracking fires correctly before launch

- You must know how to verify tracking — not assume it works.

2. CallRail & Call Tracking

- Configure CallRail numbers

- Validate call routing

- Confirm attribution is working correctly

- Test inbound call flows

3. WordPress & Forms

- Configure WP Forms

- Set up SMTP
 routing

- Deploy Cloudflare Turnstile

- QA Unbounce forms

- Test end-to-end form submissions

4. QA & Testing

- Execute onboarding QA checklists

- Detect tracking issues within 48 hours

- Conduct structured post-launch audits

- Retest after fixes

- Escalate issues clearly and immediately



Required Skills

- Hands-on experience with GA4

- Working knowledge of Google Tag Manager (GTM)

- Experience with WordPress

- Experience configuring web forms

- Strong troubleshooting ability

- High attention to detail

- Strong written English

- Comfortable following structured SOPs

- You must be comfortable testing your work multiple times before marking it complete.



Preferred Experience

- CallRail experience

- Unbounce experience

- DNS basics

- Agency experience

- Understanding of paid ads attribution



What We Are Looking For

This role is ideal for:

- Detail-oriented professionals

- QA-focused operators

- People who enjoy troubleshooting

- Individuals who escalate issues early

- Professionals who prefer precision over visibility



This Role Is NOT For

- People who guess instead of verify

- People who avoid troubleshooting

- Candidates looking for strategy or client-facing roles

- Individuals who miss details

- Anyone uncomfortable working inside structured processes



Growth Path

- Analytics Implementation Specialist ? Senior Implementation Specialist

- Senior-level tea
mbers help improve QA systems and train new hires.

- Growth is based on reliability and precision.



IMPORTANT: How to Apply

To apply, please include:

- A 2–4 minute Loom video introducing yourself

- A brief explanation of a GA4, GTM, or form tracking issue you diagnosed and fixed

- Your available work hours (confirm PST overlap)

- Your internet speed (upload & download)

- Applications missing these will not be reviewed.



If you enjoy clean implementations, structured QA, and making sure tracking works perfectly before launch — this role will fit.

If you prefer creative or strategic work over precision execution, this role will not be a fit.

title: Data Assistant
description:
Company Description



Charm is a GTM agency that works with clients in numerous industries and assists them by building and managing Customer Service, Sales, and Marketing teams. With more than 5 years of experience, Charm has established itself as an essential element of over 100 unique companies.





Client Description



The client is an online retailer for UTV (Utility Task Vehicles) parts. Founded in 2018, they are based in the US and primarily serve US customers.





Role Description



This position involves managing product data and ensuring accurate, up-to-date listings on UTV Source's ecommerce platform. Responsibilities include loading new products, updating product data, handling price adjustments, and using spreadsheets to analyze and manage data.





Requirements



Uploading new products to the ecommerce platform with all required data points (e.g., descriptions, SKUs, images, pricing).

Ensuring the accuracy and completeness of product listings by cross-referencing vendor data.

Managing price adjustments based on vendor updates and market trends.

Utilizing spreadsheet tools (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets) for data analysis, including identifying discrepancies and updating records.

Collaborating with the purchasing and marketing teams to ensure products are presented effectively online.

Troubleshooting data or backend issues related to product listings.

Maintaining organized records of product changes and updates.

Regularly auditing the website to ensure product information is current and aligns with the latest vendor catalogs.

Maintaining a high level of attention to detail to ensure accuracy across all product data and listings.

 

 



Desired Skills



Experience with ecommerce platforms, data entry, and spreadsheet tools like Excel or Google Sheets. Familiarity with UTV or motorsports products is a plus but not required.

Proficiency with ecommerce platforms, such as Big Commerce, Shopify, Magento, or similar.

Strong experience with spreadsheet tools, including Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets (e.g., formulas, pivot tables, VLOOKUP).

Experience handling and organizing large datasets for accurate entry and analysis.

Ability to research and source accurate product specifications from vendors.

Familiarity with price adjustments and market comparison techniques.

Knowledge of UTV or motorsports products is preferred but not required.

Strong organizational and time management skills to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

Basic knowledge of HTML or website backend systems is a plus but not required.

 



Pay



Base Hourly Rate: $4 - $5 (based on background and experience)



Please complete this assessment to apply for this role:

title: Finance & Accounting - Full time
description:
URGENT HIRING!



Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.

title: Welcome to K-POP Universe : Office Admin Role for E-Commerce ! Join the Beat !
description:
- Recruitment validity period: Until 3 business days from the date of the first recruitment announcement

- A PH VA team of more than 5 people has already been formed, and business collaboration is possible using Tagalog in a comfortable atmosphere.

- Providing educational tutorial videos and operating a mentorship program to help new comers quickly adapt



[About Us]

* Company Introduction (Video):

youtu.be/dO2mWWZANx8



[Join Summitree and Write Your K-POP Legacy Alongside Filipinos]

Summitree envisions leveraging their Filipino employees' intelligence and English fluency to expand globally while sharing their passion for K-POP. They highlight the Philippines' crucial role in their expansion plans, emphasizing collaboration with their Filipino team to make a mark in the K-POP world. Joining Summitree means joining a multicultural team (Korea, Philippines, Mongolia, Others) with a shared goal of making K-POP history.



[Responsibilities]

We are looking for a “Full-Time” Office Admin to handle our business.

You will be doing a variety of tasks, almost all of which we will create tutorials for you.

1. Order fulfillment and shipping label generation

You will be responsible for gathering and processing customer orders accurately and efficiently. This includes coordinating with third-party logistics (3PL) providers for inbound and outbound shipments to ensure smooth operations.

2. Product listing and scheduling

As a distributor of K-POP records and merchandise, you will be involved in registering new products into our system. This includes managing inventory, updating product information, and ensuring accurate data entry. Additionally, you will be responsible for scheduling release dates and managing timelines using tools like Google Calendar.

3. Sales & Marketing

You will be responsible for studying and trying how to gain traffics to our shopping mall. Active working on research articles related to SEO, social marketing and finding where and how to promote our shopping mall is required.

4. Customer service support

providing excellent customer service is crucial to us. You will be responsible for addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction. Your communication skills and problem-solving abilities will play a vital role in maintaining strong relationships with our valued customers.



[Required qualifications & skillset (must have)]

* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills

* Experience in puchasing K-POP Album or knowledge of K-POP related products (album, merchandise)

* Idea of how to promote K-POP albums and gain traffics in our shopping mall in PH online K-POP community for each artists



[Desired qualifications & skillset (nice to have)]

* Experience in handling customer service

* Experience in Photoshop

* Experience in
 Ads or Google Ads

* Knowledge and Experience of Microsoft Excel & Familar with Using Various Formula

* Experience in experience in Amazon Business (Familiar with Interface and function) or other E-commerce Platform



[Compensation & Employment Terms]

* ONLY Looking for a full time employee

* $300~$400/mo. determined based on the candidate’s skills, experience, and overall evaluation relative to other applicants

* One-year renewable Contract

- Compensation and terms may be adjusted based on attendance, teamwork, and performance.

- Exceptional performers may be considered for early renewal or adjustment. (multiple successful cases)

* 6-month probationary period with possibility of early conversion to regular position based on performance (multiple successful cases)



[Perks & Benefits]

1. Regular Employee Benefits

- 13th Month Salary provided

- 10 additional paid leave days upon regularization

2. Birthday Benefit (After 6 Months of Employment)

- Receive one free K-POP album of your favorite artist on your birthday

3. Paid Holidays (Regardless of Employment Status)

- January 1st (New Year’s Day) and Christmas Day are paid holidays

- Applies to both probationary and regular employees

4. Performance-Based Incentives

- Additional incentives may be provided during high-performance sales periods

(Example: major comeback seasons for artists such as BTS or Stray Kids)

5. Long Service Incentive Program

- 1-Year Service / 3-Year Service / 5-Year Service



[How To Apply for the job]

Just Fill out 10 Simple Questions through Google Form





Interview via google meet will be conducted after first screening and candidates will be notifed to their
s or
 



Thank you



Human Resource Dept.

Summitree

title: Digital Media Manager
description:
Who We Are

Brighton Foot Clinic / Stride Lab is a leading Australian podiatry clinic and innovation brand, dedicated to helping people move better and feel their best. We’re known for our friendly, family-like team culture, advanced technology, and creative approach to healthcare. Our values: compassion, growth, integrity, and going above and beyond for our patients and each other.

If you’re creative, reliable, and love digital marketing, we want you on our team!



Job Overview

Full-time, remote (work from home)

Long-term position

Growing Australian healthcare brand



Key Responsibilities

- Plan, create, and manage digital marketing campaigns on
, Instagram, and TikTok

- Build and optimise marketing funnels to drive leads and sales

- Package and create engaging content (posts, stories, reels, short-form video)

- Set up, monitor, and optimise digital ads for best ROI

- Track analytics and report results

- Collaborate with our team to deliver fresh, on-brand creative ideas



Qualifications

- 2+ years’ experience in digital marketing and ads management 
, Instagram, TikTok)

- Experience building and managing marketing funnels (e.g. ClickFunnels, GoHighLevel, etc.)

- Strong skills in content creation (graphics, copy, video editing)

- Reliable, proactive, and able to work independently

- Team player with a growth mindset and strong initiative

- Excellent English communication skills (written & spoken)

Bonus: Experience in medical/health/clinic marketing



Why Join Us?

- Be part of a friendly, supportive, and collaborative team

- Family environment—belonging, respect, and open communication matter to us

- Flexible work-from-home setup

- Real opportunity to grow your skills and make an impact



How to Apply

- Send your updated CV/resume

- Include a portfolio of your best work (content, ads, funnels)

- Record a short video introduction (1-2 min) explaining why you’re a great fit

- Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.



Ready to help us grow and become part of our family? Apply now! ????

title: Lead Generation Specialist – Service Accommodation Sector
description:
Location: Remote / UK-Based (with flexibility for occasional online meetings)

Employment Type: Part time 2-3hrs per day

Project Based of 3 to 4 months

Work Remotely? Yes



**PLEASE READ THOROUGHLY. BELOW IS THE INSTRUCTION TO APPLY. DIRECT EMAIL WILL NOT BE ENTERTAINED.



About Us

Aisiki Group is a growing property company specialising in serviced accommodation, long-term lets, and HMO management. We provide high-quality housing solutions to contractors, corporate clients, insurance companies, and relocation agencies. As we expand, we are seeking a motivated Lead Generation Specialist to drive business growth through targeted prospecting and pipeline management for our Service Accommodation business.



Website

https://www.aisiki.co.uk/



Role

The Lead Generation Specialist will be responsible for sourcing, researching, and qualifying potential B2B leads, ensuring a consistent flow of opportunities for our service accommodation services. You will use a mix of technology, data-driven research, and communication skills to open doors with decision-makers and help us maximise occupancy and direct bookings.



Key Responsibilities

? Identify and research potential clients (contractors, relocation agencies, corporate housing teams, insurance companies, etc.)

? Use tools such as Hunter.io (and similar platforms) to source verified contact details and decision-maker information

? Manage and execute outreach campaigns using Mailjet (and similar platforms) to engage prospects effectively

? Maintain accurate records of leads, interactions, and pipeline stages in the CRM (Less Annoying CRM)

? Build targeted email sequences, nurture campaigns, and follow-up strategies to increase engagement

? Support marketing with data for B2B campaigns and lead lists

? Report on lead generation performance, conversion metrics, and ROI of campaigns

? Collaborate with the wider team to align lead generation efforts with business growth goals



Must Haves

? Proven experience in lead generation, B2B sales support, or business development, ideally within property, serviced accommodation, or hospitality

? Proficiency with tools such as Hunter.io (or similar prospecting tools) and Mailjet (or other email automation platforms)

? Strong CRM usage (Less Annoying CRM preferred, but other CRM experience considered)

? Excellent written communication skills with the ability to craft engaging outreach messages

? Data-driven mindset with strong organisational and reporting skills

? Ability to work independently, prioritise tasks, and deliver results against set targets

? A proactive, self-motivated, and resilient approach to lead nurturing and conversion



*Please do not apply if you do not have relevant experience. 



Basic Requirements

- At least 50mbps stable internet connection

- Working computer/ laptop

- Minimal to no power outage in the area



Where/How to apply?: 

Please fill-out the form 

https://forms.lessannoyingcrm.com/view/4042127041484592599463446851224



*Please strictly follow instruction or your application will not be entertained. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted. 



Remuneration

£3.75 ($4.85 depending on current conversion rate) per hour, 2 hours per day, 5 days a week, 40-60s hours per month. Hours and rate may increase depending on performance.



Commission Based only? No

title: WordPress Developer
description:
Job Overview



We are looking for a skilled and reliable WordPress Developer to join our team on a trial basis. This role is ideal for someone who is confident working independently, can deliver high-quality work quickly, and is open to a potential long-term opportunity based on performance.



You will be responsible for building, updating, and maintaining WordPress websites to ensure they are functional, user-friendly, and optimized for performance.



Key Responsibilities



Develop, customise, and maintain WordPress websites

Build pages using themes and/or page builders (e.g. Elementor, WPBakery, etc.)

Implement website updates and new features

Ensure websites are responsive and mobile-friendly

Optimise website speed and performance

Troubleshoot and fix bugs or technical issues

Integrate plugins and third-party tools where required

Maintain website security and backups

Required Skills & Experience

Proven experience as a WordPress Developer

Strong knowledge of WordPress themes and plugins

Experience with page builders (Elementor preferred)

Basic understanding of HTML, CSS (PHP and JavaScript a plus)

Experience optimising website performance

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

Good written English communication skills

Available to start immediately



Trial Details



Initial trial period (length to be agreed)

Paid trial project or short-term contract

Performance during the trial will determine potential long-term collaboration



Application Requirements



Updated CV

Portfolio of previous WordPress websites (live links required)

Brief summary of your role in each project

Confirmation of availability to start immediately

Applications without portfolio links will not be considered.



Opportunity



For the right candidate, this trial can lead to ongoing work and a long-term position.

title: Creative Support Specialist (Quality Assurance Focus)
description:
Mon–Fri | 8:00 AM–5:00 PM (PHT)

100% Remote | Open to Filipino Applicants Only

Love Design… But Obsessed with Why It Works (or Fails)?



If you’re the type who:

• Notices alignment issues instantly

• Questions why a client wasn’t satisfied

• Spots patterns in feedback others miss



Then this isn’t a design role — it’s a design quality powerhouse role.

We’re looking for a Creative Support Specialist who will serve as the quality guardian of our creative team. You won’t be creating graphics — you’ll be dissecting them. You’ll analyze outcomes, identify root causes, reduce revisions, and elevate overall design performance.

You are the person who protects the standard.



What You’ll Actually Do

• Audit completed design projects (especially neutral/negative feedback cases)

• Evaluate alignment with client briefs, brand guidelines & design fundamentals

• Break down client feedback into actionable root-cause insights

• Identify recurring patterns across designers and project types

• Report findings to Team Leaders & HR

• Recommend improvements to training, workflows & quality processes

• Help reduce cancellations and improve client satisfaction scores



This role is analytical, objective, and impact-driven.

What Makes You a Strong Fit

• Strong grasp of layout, typography, branding & color theory

• Analytical mindset — you separate taste from true design flaws

• Experience in QA, art direction, creative review, or quality control (highly preferred)

• Comfortable delivering direct, evidence-based feedback

• Organized, detail-oriented, and process-focused

• Data-driven thinker who enjoys tracking performance trends



Technical Requirements

• Reliable computer (can open/edit design files)

• Stable high-speed internet

• 720p (or higher) webcam

• Working headset or microphone



Why You’ll Love Working With Us

• Performance recognition & incentives

• Supportive, collaborative remote culture

• Career growth & advancement opportunities

• Paid maternity & paternity leave

• Monthly contests & creative challenges

• Long-term, stable remote role

• Paid time off (monthly accrual)

• Wellness & mental health support

• Ongoing training & mentorship



Bonus Points If You

• Have experience with project management or ticketing tools

• Have a background in Graphic Design + Customer Support/Success

• Can create simple quality or trend reports

• Enjoy turning messy feedback into structured insights



How to Apply?

1. Complete the application form:


2. For “Please type the magic phrase”, enter:

qualitymatters

3. Attach your portfolio and resume highlighting QA/review experience.

title: Shopify & CheckoutChamp Developer
description:
We're looking for a developer who lives and breathes CheckoutChamp and Shopify.



---



What You'll Own



- Build and maintain all web pages, funnels, and checkout flows - in CheckoutChamp & Shopify

- Set up and configure CheckoutChamp's CRM platform: product settings, campaign settings, and integrations

- Code custom checkout experiences optimized for conversion and speed

- Ensure every page is responsive, fast-loading, and bug-free across all devices

- Code all Shopify pages/sections in JSON for ease of access inside the Shopify CMS

- Work alongside our design and strategy team to bring briefs to life—and push back when something doesn't make sense from a development perspective

- Maintain clean version control and documentation so nothing depends on tribal knowledge



---



Requirements



- 2+ years of hands-on experience with CheckoutChamp—setting up the platform, building funnels, and coding custom checkouts

- 2+ years working with Shopify stores

- Fluent in Liquid, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS

- Ability to code easily customizable sections in Shopify (using JSON)

- Experience coding checkout flows and CRM configurations in CheckoutChamp specifically

- Comfortable working asynchronously with a remote team across multiple timezones



---



This Is NOT For You If:



- You don't have real, hands-on experience with CheckoutChamp

- You can't create customizable sections in Shopify

- You're not responsive—we need someone who replies within hours, not days

- You're unorganized or regularly miss deadlines

- You see development as just "making things look good" rather than driving conversions

- You're not comfortable communicating with non-technical people



---



What We Offer



- Potential full-time remote position after trial period

- Work directly with a small, high-output team that’s growing fast

- One brand, one mission—no client juggling

- Opportunity to own and shape the entire technical infrastructure as the company scales



---



Hiring Process:



1. Submit your application

2. Initial screening call

3. Technical assessment task

4. Initial paid trial period



We move fast. If you're the right fit, you'll know within a week.



---



How to Apply:



If this sounds like you, please fill out the form below and you will hear back from us soon!

title: Dispatch & Logistics VA
description:
We are looking for a reliable Dispatch & Logistics VA with proven experience in fleet coordination to manage dispatch operations for our 20-truck refrigerated fleet. This position requires dispatch expertise, clear communication abilities, and understanding of logistics operations in a 24/7 environment.



Key Responsibilities:



– Manage daily dispatch operations for refrigerated trucking fleet

– Monitor truck locations and routes using Samsara GPS tracking software

– Verify and track reefer temperature compliance for all trailers

– Coordinate with drivers on schedules, routes, and operational matters

– Track vehicle inspection compliance (90-day and annual inspections)

– Maintain inspection documentation and compliance records

– Respond to operational issues and coordinate resolutions

– Support flexible operational demands across high and low seasons

– Communicate effectively with drivers and management

– Maintain organized dispatch records and fleet status updates



Requirements:



– Previous dispatch and logistics coordination experience

– Professional English communication skills (written and verbal)

– Experience with GPS tracking and fleet management systems

– Understanding of refrigerated trucking operations

– Knowledge of commercial vehicle compliance requirements

– Detail-oriented with strong organizational abilities

– Self-directed and capable of independent decision-making

– Available Monday-Saturday, 8 hours daily (PST timezone)

– Flexible regarding day or night shift scheduling



Preferred Skills:



– Samsara GPS software experience

– Refrigerated transportation or temperature-controlled logistics background

– DOT compliance and vehicle inspection knowledge

– Experience in trucking or logistics company operations

– Proven reliability in dispatch coordination roles



What We Provide:



– Direct access to company leadership

– Comprehensive training on systems and procedures

– Stable long-term position with growing operation

– Flexible schedule accommodating operational requirements

– Hands-on fleet management experience



If you bring dispatch experience and logistics coordination skills to manage our fleet operations, apply now and advance your career with our trucking company.

title: GHL Workflow & Email Specialist
description:
Job Overview

We are looking for a meticulous and organized GHL
 Marketing Specialist to support the execution and optimization of
 marketing initiatives. The role involves managing campaigns end-to-end — from setup and testing to monitoring performance and maintaining deliverability. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of GoHighLevel (GHL) or similar CRM platforms, ensuring that every campaign is accurate, compliant, and aligned with performance goals.



Key Responsibilities

* Plan, execute, and schedule
 campaigns, automations, and workflows using GoHighLevel or comparable tools.

* Monitor and optimize deliverability metrics, including inbox placement, spam rates, and bounce performance.

* Clean and manage contact databases, apply list segmentation, and ensure compliance with data hygiene best practices.

title: Talent Acquisition
description:
Are you an organized and motivated individual with a passion for recruitment and client success? We’re looking for a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join our fast-paced, dynamic team! mbers as the company expands.

If you're looking for a versatile role that combines recruitment and client relationship management in a fast-paced and innovative environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today and take the next step in your career with us!

description:

 - Familiarity with tools like 
 or similar task managers

Why Join Us

You’ll be part of a well-organized, supportive environment with structured SOPs and opportunities to continually develop your e-commerce skills.

title: Social Media Video Editor
description:
We do not evaluate candidates by years of experience. We evaluate by output.



We are looking for someone who can consistently produce high-quality, high-volume, performance-driven content across TikTok, X, Instagram, YouTube, and Reddit without sacrificing precision.



This role requires a deep understanding of native content mechanics and conversion-driven execution: 



- You understand that every platform operates differently

- You create platform-native content, not recycled edits

- You understand how hooks differ across short-form vertical, long-form horizontal, feeds and threads

- You know how to structure retention and increase watch time

- You know how to drive conversion to our website without sounding overly promotional



Native-first thinking is required.



You optimize continuously:



- Testing hooks

- Testing formats

- Testing video length

- Testing captions and thumbnails

- Iterating based on retention, CTR, engagement and conversion data.



You do not guess, you measure. You don't post and hope, but you refine and scale what works.



Your content must: 



- Capture attention within first two seconds

- Feel fully native to the platform

- Communicatie value clearly and efficiently

- Drive a strong and natural call to action



You understand exactly who you are creating for. You tailor messaging, pacing, references and tone to the viewers most likely to watch, engage and convert. You build for the right audience, not the broadest one.



We are looking for someone who treats content as a scalable growth system, not just creative output.



If you think in hooks, retention curves and conversion funnels, you will fit right in here.
